Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DLM212
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop on a two week trip to Italy, and it was a pleasant way to begin. We took the Alilaguna water taxi from the airport to the Rialto bridge stop and, from there, it was about a four minute walk to the hotel. We arrived at around 1pm and were greeted very warmly and showed to our room right away. The staff, without exception, were very nice, helpful and professional. The hotel and room were immaculate and the whole place was obviously very well cared for. The rooms are typical for Europe in size, but very opulent. We had a King bed with high quality linens and drapes, and ornate, polished decorations like Murano glass wall mounted chandeliers. The bathroom was huge and even more lavish than the room with, among other things, towel warmers and a 12" diameter shower head. I was surprised at the quality of the place because I booked it through an online tour company and it was an upgrade that cost only a little more per night (about $25) than the bargain rate place, located on Lido Island, suggested on the original itinerary. I should also mention that the package included the hotels buffet breakfast which was excellent; fresh food and plenty of variety. I don't spend a lot of time in hotels when I travel, so all of the stuff I just mentioned was just a bonus to me. The location of the hotel was the best part of the experience for us. It is a perfect base point to make any destination on the island comfortably accessible by foot. My wife and I walked everywhere in Venice from that hotel and did this at quite a leisurly pace. It is minutes, literally steps, to the Rialto Bridge where you can cross the canal on foot, or jump on the water taxi. Minutes in the other direction and you will be in San Marco Square and everything that has to offer. On two evenings we walked from the hotel to the Cannaregio*** for dinner and the walk back was just right to help get the blood flowing again after a great Italian meal. If you don't wish to wander too far from La Commedia, there is shopping, dining and entertainment ( Teatro Goldoni) in the immediate vicinity. One evening we saw a bit of Vivaldi performed by a small string ensemble in a church around the corner from the hotel, which was very enjoyable. If I return to Venice any time soon I would, without question, stay at La Commedia. ***I highly recommend the Cannaregio, by the way, if you want to get off the beaten track and venture where few tourists ever seem to go. Here you will find restaurants and cafes along the Fondamenta Misericordia and Rio di S.Girolamo that are the real deal and frequented by locals. If you go during the day and early evening, it's very peaceful. Later at night (after 9pm), some of the places get very busy, so plan accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Steve7887
Reviews.Content: We booked through Citalia, flew with Jet2 from Manchester, and used the Alilaguna water bus from the airport to Rialto. The directions given on the hotel's website were very clear and it was easy to find - literally a two-minute walk with no bridges to cross. The greeting could not have been warmer, with a very efficient reception. A member of staff took us up in the excellent lift to our room on the first floor. The room was an elegant gold and cream, very tasteful and restful. There was loads of space, with a desk, table and two easy chairs as well as the canopied bed. The bathroom was well appointed with plenty of space around the washbasin, a bath with both a hand shower and a fixed overhead one, and a bidet. There was good drawer and hanging space, certainly adequate for two people for a week. The cupboard contained a large electronic safe. There was also a well stocked mini-bar, with no restrictions on keeping your own water in it. The room was at the back of the hotel, with double-glazed windows overlooking a normally quiet lane. The room was cleaned and tidied each day, and bedding turned down in the evening, with a couple of sweets left on a card with the next day's weather forecast - a lovely touch. The bar was friendly, warm and comfortable, with plenty of atmosphere. The price of drinks was not excessive when compared to the usual high cost of alcohol in Venice. Breakfast was the usual continental mix of fresh fruit, yoghurt, cold meats and cheeses, with a variety of cereals, breads and crackers. There was also scrambled eggs and bacon - we didn't ask for anything extra, but I guess they would have cooked eggs to order. Tea or coffee was served at the table (the coffee, of course, was excellent)! La Commedia is perfectly situated, being two minutes from Rialto and 10 minutes from St Mark's Square. There are plenty of restaurants and shops on the way to Piazza St Marco. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times, and spoke excellent English. Checkout was smart and efficient, with no delay. I have no hesitation in thoroughly recommending Hotel a la Commedia for any length of stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury for our last stop in Italy”
Reviews.Author: Stephen S
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent, Beach Bum Lisa, picked the La Commedia for us as our last stop on our first anniversary trip thru Italy. We were very impressed. The hotel oozed luxury. The front desk staff was as expected, very nice and knowledgeable, and even helped us save a little money by arranging a group gondola ride with other guests at their hotel. La Commedia was very well kept and met all of our expectations, even exceeded them with the gold inlay in the bathroom floors. I don't know why, but that still sticks with me even after our entire trip through Italy. I guess it was just symbolic of just how much La Commedia personified luxury, even though we tried to travel on a budget. I would absolutely recommend staying here if you are travelling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very High Standards of Service and Comfort ...”
Reviews.Author: Lisianthus56
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a our 31st Wedding Anniversary in April. The hotel staff were well informed about local attractions and restaurants and always courteous and helpful. They were willing to arrange local excursions and make table reservations for us. They arranged a shared Gondola trip for us that cut down on the cost considerably. Our room on the 3rd floor was clean and very comfortable with every facilty that one could wish for. We did not experience any disruption from outside noise. The choice offered at breakfast was excellent. The hotel is in a central and convenient location for St Mark's Square and the Rialto and within comfortable walking distance of the Water Taxis and the Vaporetto. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury hotel, family-friendly”
Reviews.Author: Tina F F
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay as a family of 5 at this hotel in April. Very high quality decor and service, great location. The very professional and welcoming staff deserve a special mention. We'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a lovely city...”
Reviews.Author: TraceyLei
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Commedia in early April and loved it. I paid for the airport to hotel transfer as I had saved for a long time for this trip and was doing it in style. The trip from the airport to the hotel was fantastic - private water taxi surfing the waves and throwing up spray all the way - it was so exhilarating. Then coming in under the Rialto Bridge and being met by a hotel staff member to lug my suitcase and show me to the hotel. On the way back to the airport they took me through the Grand Canal so I could get a last look at the beauty of Venice. The transfer is very expensive however and it is unlikely I will utilise it again. Also, the hotel says that included in the transfer are some guided activities - a gondola ride, a walking tour. They actually aren't included though, the hotel will get you a subsidised rate. I ended up taking part in none of the activities and they should ensure they cease giving the impression that these activities are going to be free. This is my only issue with La Commedia and is solved by me not using the transfer service again. Everything else was wonderful. They upgraded me to a Junior Suite on arrival and it was lovely. Spacious, clean, well appointed and plush. There was a turn down service every day which left me a chocolate and tomorrow's weather report - very handy. The bathroom was large, clean and had an overhead as well as handheld shower option over the bath. Fantastic for an Aussie traveller. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and I was given a stamp for a free drink in their bar. It is just a small area in the foyer but it was perfectly nice and provided a good place for me to write up my experiences at the end of the day. (Unfortunately the rooftop bar only opens in Summer). The breakfast room was nice and the breakfast provided was everything I needed and more. Cereal, pastries, fruit, tea etc that I partook of, and extras like eggs and bacon for those that prefer a more hearty breakfast. Again the staff were very attentive and helpful. The restaurant next door to the hotel whilst outside of my usual price range provided a lovely last evening's meal and the waitstaff there are fantastic. If I manage to save enough money to be able to afford high luxury again on my next trip I will definitely be staying at La Commedia.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Venice”
Reviews.Author: Linda0z
Reviews.Content: A hidden gem and possibly the best city centre hotel I have ever stayed in. La Commedia is ideally suited to explore all of the highlights in Venice. Rooms are fabulous and breakfast is just perfect. Staff are helpful and full of ideas to help you enjoynthisbwonderful city .......even in the rain!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: julie0001
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently stayed a full week at this wonderful hotel. The staff treated us as family. The breakfast was great, we never tired of the selections. Beautiful marble stairs, rooftop paito, and of course the location can't be beat. Our room was very pretty and quiet, #404. Thank you Hotel A La Commedia for an absolutely unforgettable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Really personal service and super location”
Reviews.Author: Gssem
Reviews.Content: Having booked fairly last minute we were surprised at how amazing this place was, my husband hurt his hand on the saturday and the staff helped us find a doctor within the hour who came to the hotel to help. The location was perfect and quiet but two seconds away from the thick of it very worth visiting and superb staff !!

Reviews.Title: “Some rooms can be very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: MPL1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, seconds from the Rialto Bridge, just a few minutes walk from San Marco, the Accademia, and all sights of Venice. It's down a side street, so don't expect views. Also, most of the hotel is situated above ground floor shops and bars, so if you are given a room on the 1st floor, make sure it is not above the snack bar Torino (parts of room 115 definitely are). We had this room on the first night of our 4 night stay, and were kept awake well into the early hours of the morning with very loud music. The night receptionist's response felt scripted and well rehearsed yet the management's response the next morning when we asked for a change of room was that it was an unusual occurrence. Whether the bar usually plays music so late may be debatable, but they certainly were playing loud music when we passed by later during our stay so if you want to retire early after pounding the streets, ask for a room on the upper levels and/or near the breakfast room. That said, the rooms were well appointed (excellent beds) and extremely clean and the breakfast provided was of a good quality. To get to the hotel from the airport we took public transport (vaporetto - Alilagune linea arancia). With hindsight, we should have taken a water taxi...we had to wait 30 mins for the departure and it took another 60 mins to get there, stuck inside a hot, stuffy cabin with a limited view. So if you you are not on a tight budget, it is worth the 110 euros to arrive in style!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in very Central Position in Venice”
Reviews.Author: BazNorthamptonshire
Reviews.Content: Visited Venice for the first time to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. The hotel was in the heart of Venice and in easy reach of all the main points of interest - unless you get lost down all the side streets as we did several times! The hotel was very close to the Rialto Bridge and all the designer shops so very easy to find. The hotel itself was very nice and although our Deluxe room was not huge, it was very well fitted out, very smart, in excellent condition and extremely clean and had a nice bathroom (important to a woman!). All the staff were extremely courteous and spoke several languages. Would highly recommend and if we went back to Venice would stay there again. Thank you Hotel a La Commedia.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: s08cpage
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying here I stayed here 4 yrs ago at this hotel the standards has stayed the same. It s of very high standards the staff are very friendly and welcoming. My room was amazing i couldnt fault it one bit. The breakfast was of very good choice and very fresh. The hotel is situated just of the Rialto bridge in easy acces off all sights. I would recomend going to the Rialto fresh market first thing in the morning I enjoyed looking and buy from them. I would hightly recomend going of the beaten track where you see the real Venice no tourists. you wont get lost just find signs for the Rialto or san Marco you cant go wrong . I went alone I didnt feel once uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: meganWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights at this Hotel and were so happy we chose it. Staff were without exception excellent. The rooms were large very comfortable and well equipped as were the bathrooms. the breakfasts had a good choice with bacon scrambled egg boiled egg or a good selection of cerial fruit meat etc.the position of this hotel is great as it is only two minutes walk from the Rialto bridge and five minutes from St. Marks Square. (If you don't get lost as we did regularly) The Hotel was easy to get to from the airport. We got a bus from the door of the airport (5 euros) to the P.leRoma where we got the vaparetto (6.50 euros ) to the Rialto Bridge then a two minute walk to the Hotel. Venice is quite expensive but if you go to the side streets for your meals it is not bad drinks are the worst with a glass or can of sprite or coke coffee or tea being 4.50euros or 5euros I went with my daughter and some friends and we had a great time well worth going and this Hotel made it even better

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Louise S
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights. Lovely room in a great convenient location for the waterbus (2 minutes from Rialto stop), five minute walk to San Marco. Friendly, welcoming staff on reception, bar and breakfast room. Would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Venice”
Reviews.Author: Henrywboxall
Reviews.Content: We spent our 25th Wedding anniversary in Venice. we had a very special & unforgettable time. The quality and location of the Hotel was great, a stoneâ€™s throw from the Grand Canal and short walk to St Marks Square. The staff att the Hotel were exellent and very freindly. Ps Venice quite exspensive take plenty of euros

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Capelle aan den IJssel, The Netherlands
Reviews.Title: “recommend”
Reviews.Author: Jos J W H
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and very friendly personal. This was the 7th time we were in Venice and it is really the best hotel we experienced. The price was reasonable. We spend here 5 nights and are planning to come back. Probably in october.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: BigMouldy
Reviews.Content: We visited the Hotel A La Commedia on 7 March for 2 nights. We chose this hotel after reading the fantastic reviews. First of all we had been undecisive about how to get to the hotel, whether to book a water taxi (at Â£50 one way for a shared boat it's not cheap) or whether to wait for the Vaporetto (water bus) - we decided to arrive in style in the speedboat water taxi option and I'm so glad we did - what a way to arrive into the city! The water taxi was waiting for us with 2 other couples and we sped straight off! The hotel is literally a 2 minute walk from the Rialto Bridge which is where we got dropped off and is really easy to find. We were upgraded to a suite which was a nice surprise - the rooms are gorgeous and spacious with a lovely bathroom and very clean. The cleaner also turns your bed for you at night and leaves chocolates and the weather forecast for the next day on the bed. We were on the third floor and the room was really quiet both from outside noise (and there is a constant stream of people walking by) and from other occupants of the hotel. Breakfast is a great start to the day, fruit juices, tea/coffee, cereal, cold meats, cheese, fresh fruit, yoghurt, scrambled egg, bacon, croissants, bread rolls, biscuits. San Marco square is a 5 minute walk away. We also went on a gondalier ride which we caught at the back of San Marco square for 80 euros - obviously very expensive but well worth it for 40 minutes. Be sure to haggle as the original price started at 120 euros! We ate at Hard Rock Cafe the first night, bottle of wine, starter between us and 2 mains cost 65 euros and the second night we ate at Da Mamo which has also been recommended on Trip Advisor. We both had pizza which was delicious but we weren't that keen on the environment as the tables are pushed so close together you feel like you are having dinner with the couple next to you - food was tasty though and at reasonable prices. All in all we had a fantastic short break and can't wait to go back - we would definately go back to the same hotel, we couldn't have asked for anything more!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: MANHATTAN_F
Reviews.Content: Stay 3 nights in this hotel and all was perfect : calm, clean, well situed and hotel employees friendly and professional breakfast buffet was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: zonafan00
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights and the hotel was fantastic! We loved the location. It was centrally located. The only annoying thing we noticed was music being played at night about a block away in the square until about 11pm. Service was top notch! The decor of the room was a charming, Venetian style.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: holhNorway
Reviews.Content: Excelent hotel. Perfect location, only 2 min. from Rialto with convenient boat transport to the airport. Very nice room, good breakfast, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, tidy and well located”
Reviews.Author: Ken E
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great loation, 2 minutes walk from Rialto bridge, and 5 minutes walk from San Marco's square. the room was very nice, clean, well equipped and tidy. it appear all details have been thought of. service was great, and we received several complemntary gifts and services (drinks at the bar, fruit basket, chocolates, daily weather forecast). breakfast was also delicious, although vegetables were missing. overall a great experience an a really friendly staff. would definitely reccomend this small and warm hotel!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Saint Petersburg, Saint Petersburg City, Russia
Reviews.Title: “Carnival in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Galina_Shuvalova
Reviews.Content: Excelent hotel! Good location in the center. Very friendly staff. Good breakfast! "-" Unstable wi-fi

Reviews.Title: “recommend this hotel to everyone”
Reviews.Author: Thienpont
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been the cherry on the cake that our stay in Venice has been. It is situated very central, nearby public transport. The reception staff is very helpfull en has every client special deals to offer that the hotel has made with gondoliers, restaurants and theaters in the city. The service is really superb: flowers were immediatly brought to the room and set in water, personal assistence to the room, the luggage is brought to the room afterwards, a 'do not disturb' button that you can leave on while you are gone, a weatherforecast on the bed with some chocolates even if you were only 30 min away with the 'do not disturb bottun' switched off, roomservices that videotaped my engagement in the hotelroom. A very comfortable room, soundfree with a big bathroom. Breakfast in a very nice atmosphere and with lots of choices. In Short: the perfect place for a nice stay in Venice. We plan to come back after the wedding

Reviews.Title: “Five years on and still amazing.”
Reviews.Author: cornetkid
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at the Commedia 5 years ago only 4 months after they opened and it was amazing then. I have never stayed in the same place twice so was a little worried that the hotel wasn't going to be as good but I was wrong. Everything from check in to check out was perfect. The room was clean, fresh, tastefully decorated. The breakfast was tasty, plenty of it, a range of different foods and the staff were always polite and helpful. The desk staff were always willing to help. I can not praise this hotel enough. Thank you again A la Commedia. We will return. D and A xx.x

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ttteppel
Reviews.Content: perfect location, very good stuff, clean and warm just only can say: Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Pawel_EPWR
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and helpful. A few steps from the grand canal and the Rialto Bridge and only 5-10 minutes walk to St Mark's square. The facility was spotless, the room was very comfortable. The breakfast room is well managed and the breakfast good. Free wi-fi is only for 30 minutes then you pay 8 euro for another 3 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Our Venetian favourite”
Reviews.Author: thetravellingdrums
Reviews.Content: We stepped from a bitterly cold day in late January into a warm lobby and to an even warmer welcome from Roberto . He greeted us by name and told us that our room was waiting for us. Yes, we had been here before. In fact, this was our fifth visit to La Commedia. The location suits us perfectly and is central for our long walks through Venice. We normally stay for seven days or more, and we find the service outstanding. The beautiful, spacious room is spotless, the staff accommodating, polite and friendly, and we always look forward to breakfast. The range is not wide, but, what is there, is of high quality, and the staff are always responsive and amicable. On the few occasions we have needed some extra assistance at Reception, staff, particularly Massimo, Frederico and Roberto, have always been prepared to help in any way they can. There is a sumptuous, elegant Venetian touch to this hotel without being kitschy. We're looking forward to returning to Venice and our Venetian hotel shortly.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Andris B
Reviews.Content: Paid for 2 nights in January around 400 EUR for a junior suite room. For Venice the price is just wright, it`s very easy to pay more, but get less of what this hotel offers. Very good location of the hotel - in the middle of everything. The Rialto bridge was within 5 min. walk. The room was large, clean, nice decorated and up to date. The bathroom had a good size. Would recommend for a city trip and also for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but watch the Free Trips.”
Reviews.Author: CAEWALES
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very central, yet reasonably quiet, very clean and provides an excellent continental breakfast. The staff were very polite and helpful. The room was not huge, but was big enough. The bathroom, on the other hand, was a good size. One thing we especially liked was that the sheets were changed after the second night. (If we were rich enough to pay someone to wash and iron them, I would change sheets nightly at home!!!! - but we are not!). The only down-side was that we were offered a "free" trip to the Murano Glass factory, and were told that we would be taken by taxi. We checked and double checked. Yes the trip was "free". Please note that there is no charge to go round the glass factory. They do this in the hope of gaining a sale (of course). On signing out of the hotel we were presented with a bill for the taxi (i.e. the full cost of the "free" trip - which could easily have been done more cheaply on the Vaporetto). Pity - this left a bad taste in the mouth. If, you take this on board for the future, and avoid such "free trips" - unless you were going to take a taxi to murano anyway, this is an excellent hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: JulieHFM
Reviews.Content: (+ means 'like', - means 'not like', = means 'average') + great location, 500m between Piazzo di Marco and 150m Rialto Bridge + nice staff + good breakfast + value for money + spacious (bath)room + cleanliness = beds

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marise_12
Reviews.Content: Overall it's a great hotel, very well located, very clean and charming. My husband and I travel quite frequently and have been to Europe many times. I could certainly say that to European standards this was an excellent choice of hotel. Perfectly located around the corner of the Rialto bridge were the water taxi drops you off. The room was very pretty and well decorated with beautiful fresh white linen. The bathroom is all marble with double sinks it seemed like it had just been renovated, with bathrobes, toiletteries, beautiful towels etc. The hotel is located in the heart of all the shops and cafes, and a 5 or 6 minutes walk to Plaza St. Marco. The staff was very efficient, and polite as well as very helpfull, with any questions we had. The breakfast was included and was excellent, with beautiful china and cutlery, and crisp white table clothes. The food selection was just what you needed fruits, cheeses, cerearl, croissants, danishes and the regular scrambled and boiled eggs, bacon etc and all very nicely presented . Of course espressos, cappucinos, and all kinds of teas are served as well. It's not a sumptuous hotel like the (Ritz) but on a smaller scale it's an excellent 4* with pretty rooms and great amenities. The only negative if I have to mention one is that there is no great views from the windows. All the buildings are close together, so there is no landscape views. The staff was very sweet, on our last day we had to checkout early because of our flight, they prepared us 2 breakfast bags full of food, we couldn't finish half of it. I highly recommend this hotel for quality, service, and location. Unless money is no object and you are looking for the "Ritz standart" this is a great hotel, I would recommend it to all my friends and would definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: William G
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Italy and Venice was our last stop after 3 visits. We really enjoyed the hotel. The room was the nicest of the three that we stayed in. Pros: Readily accessible from the Vaporretto stop with easy directions to find. This was really important for us because my wife was 5 months pregnant and we did not want to be lugging luggage through the streets of Venice. The room was a good size based on European standards. The staff was very friendly at the front and our room was always immaculate when we returned at the end of the day. It was a more modern hotel so the ammenities were also nice. The location was also convenient. We were about 5 minutes from St. Mark's Square and 2 minutes from the Vaporretto. Cons: The breakfast was just ok for us. It seems to be a standard European style breakfast. I was a little disappointed the bacon and eggs weren't ready when the breakfast started at 7am because we had to catch our plane. I also think the milk for the cereal might have spoiled. I did love the croissants and the free hot chocolate in the morning was also nice.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing City :)”
Reviews.Author: BlondieL20
Reviews.Content: Stay in this hotel approx 2 years ago at the end of September for one night before catching a Greek Isle Cruise. Our first trip to Venice and fell in love with the city. Location was perfect for us - the rialto bridge is just around the corner. There is a lovely court yard with a restaurant just outside. Shops and restaurants are just a stroll down one of the many quaint streets. Rooms are a bit on the small size but im assuming this is the norm for a city like Venice. Room were decorated lovely and contained everything we needed. The bathroom was sizeable in comparison to the bedroom. There is a quaint bar area beside the reception area - from what I recall the roof terrace bar wasnt open for drinks but you could still go up there. For the time of year we stayed I did feel that the hotel was a bit pricey. I would most certaintly stay at this hotel when we return to Venice, if the price is right. TIP: We made the mistake of hopping on the first water taxi that came along and would recommend that you do your homework as we were taken on a very long scenic route.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Compact”
Reviews.Author: ruthnralph
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, just off the Rialto vaparetto stop, near the Rialto Bridge and a short walk across to San Marco square. The staff introduced themselves as true Venetians and took pride in giving us info and directions to all the best sights on the map. We didn't take up the shared gondola ride or free trip to the Glass manufacturer on Murano options that can be organised through the hotel. Our room was 102, so an easy walk from reception up one flight of stairs. There was quite a small lift so it was good not to need it too often. Overall, we enjoyed our two night stay here. The room was comfortable, the bathroom quite large with all the extras you need, the cupboards held our bags and an in-room safe was available for our valuables. Breakfast was included and served just down the corridor on level 1. It had plenty of variety and helpful staff to bring tea/coffee/hot chocolate to the table. The bar across from reception is quite small with only 3-4 table settings. There is usually lots of bustle in and out around this area, so not somewhere to relax for long.

Reviews.Title: “great family accommodation”
Reviews.Author: lisa d
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at la Commedia Hotel with our 2 kids and were allocated a lovely set up with two rooms (210 and 211) with their own private passage between them which was ideal for a family. The hotel is very well located near the Rialto Bridge with easy access to vaporettos. However, there are definately areas that they could improve on including that the reception staff while friendly, could not direct us to any really good restaurants in the area that were not expensive tourist traps, which I really think is a service that should be offered by any good hotel. Also, the WIFI offering is also not up to scratch. You are given 30minutes of free time and thereafter you are charged. However, before the time that you have paid for is up, you are disconnected and are forced to pay again although you have not used up the previous time that you have paid for. This is hugely frustrating not to say expensive. Another area that could really be improved on is their room service offering - this is very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Perfect Location.”
Reviews.Author: Heather363
Reviews.Content: a La Commedia Hotel in Venice was gorgeous, rich in color and fabrics. 5-Star quality Staff. Continental breakfast was delicious, set in a cozy room with white table-linens, silver-ware, fresh croissants & jams, yogurts, cereals, the usual European fare. The room was designed with clean lines & rich colors and it was very quiet. The evening prior to our departure (Wed., 11/9), my husband became ill. We had to cancel a scheduled boat ride to the San Marco airport for 4am and reschedule our flights to Paris. The gentleman on staff at 4am was very gracious. He generously prepared a Sterling Silver Platter with Hot Tea and brought it to our room on the 3rd floor for my husband. Very kind. All staff spoke English very well. The hotel's location was perfect - 2 minute walk to the dock, and high-end shops, cafes, restaurants, just outside the door. We will stay at a La Commedia on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Two day stay”
Reviews.Author: denmark666
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights, and were going to stay for another day, but checked out after two. We had booked for a Deluxe room, and but were given a standard room. Staff was arrogant and not very helpful. Room was not serviced until late in the afternoon, no sitting area, could only use wi-fi for 30 minutes before being charged. No common area to sit and relax. Bar area was small and ten feet from front desk and elevator. We moved from here to another four star hotel with wifi available in the sitting area, restaurant, very helpful staff, less expensive. We travel three monhs a year and found this hotel, although up to date, not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Robin H
Reviews.Content: This is a very friendly hotel with excellent rooms one minute from the beautiful Rialto area and five minutes from San Marco. The only drawback is a lack of restaurant -- they serve breakfast and have a bar but nothing else. Luckily there are plenty of good restaurants very near, including a stunning but quite expensive one right next door.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in the centre of Venice - worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: annamtv
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Venice in November and had a lovely time. This is a great hotel, excellent staff, lovely rooms, great breakfasts - indeed pretty classy all round. The hotel is 2 minutes from the Rialto and no more than 7 minutes walk to St Marks (if you can avoid the window-shopping). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect hotel for Venice”
Reviews.Author: ChristineCunningham
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel online and it is the perfect location and in the center of everything in Venice. The hotel was beautiful, we loved our gold and white room that was big for europe. It was the most quiet place I have even been in, just peaceful. The staff was eager to please and gave great recommendations for Dining. The complimentary breakfast was just perfect and lots of choices, the cheese were fresh and wonderful...and the staff in the breakfast room were super friendly and made us feel so comfortable. We will stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: fussy58
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel through booking.com, and i must say everithing was perfect, cleanliness, location ,service, considering the bad experiences you might come across in venice, this place is highly recomended

Reviews.Title: “Just Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Alexey A
Reviews.Content: Hands down that was one of the best hotels my wife and I ever visited. Upon our arrival our room was upgraded to junior suite with no additional charge, The room was fairly big (for European standard), had a very spacious outdoor balcony facing a busy street, yet we couldn't hear a thing with the doors shut. The staff was amazingly helpful, every request was met with highest attention to details and courtesy. The location is great: a 5-minute walk to St. Marco's square, next to some of Venice's best restaurants, theaters and shopping streets. Definitely coming to both Venice and this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff, great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: DE47
Reviews.Content: A friend and I booked Hotel a La Commedia via last minute.com and had no idea what to expect, but as nearly all the reviews were glowing and the pictures looked nice I thought it was worth a look. The hotel was very easy to find, yards away from the Rialto water bus stop (2). We arrived late and hungry, the hotel reception staff were wonderful, recommending a place five mins walk away, but a little off the beaten track, so mainly local people and excellent value (a cappuccino and an espresso for just over 2.50 euro!). We'd mistakenly been put into a double instead of a twin, but the hotel staff changed the room immediately, without any fuss. The double room was lovely, but the twin simply sumptuous, really big, with a well stocked mini bar (& not too expensive either), lovely bathroom, and exceptionally high standards of cleanliness in the room and throughout the hotel. And what a lovely touch, a turn down service with a little Italian chocolate left of the bed and a card with the next day's weather forecast! The breakfast room was lovely and the service perfect, nothing too much trouble, and the range of food on offer was generous, stacks of fresh fruit, fresh fruit salad, cereal, eggs, bacon, cheeses, cold meats, coissants... So much so that lunch was often unnecessary! The hotel has a small bar, again, very reasonably priced, with a good wine and cocktail list. While in quite a busy area, the hotel is set a bit away from the thoroughfare and the sound proofing seemed to be very effective, that, and very comfortable beds ensured a good nights sleep! I really enjoyed my stay at the hotel, the staff were very knowledgeable about the area and happy to make recommendations - they even knew the times of the water buses! I would love to return to Venice, it is simply stunning, and a stay in this hotel is the icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Noangelsuze
Reviews.Content: Good location within short waikng distance to Rialto bridge ad other attractions, plenty of shops in the area. Nice breakfast with fruit, creral, bread and cheeses. Helpful staff. Nice clean rooms. Would reccomend for a short stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Dombo13
Reviews.Content: Forget all this negatives about grumpy staff, this pleace was, spotless, in a great location, had superb staff and free brekkie. Highly reccomended.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Dimi D
Reviews.Content: Everything is very good. Staff, Location and value is like a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: anita p
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this cosy hotel in november. The concierge-service was excellent and helpful, the room - we were upgraded to a suite - elegant and warm, which is especially important in wintertime. Off season the rates are also very reasonable and Venice not so crowded as usually. The location is great for all sights, the most elegant shops close by. Breakfast is very good for italian standards. A warning: The osteria on the square, not connected to the hotel, is a desaster. Expensive bad food! But of course there are other good places near by.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: SeritaDavis
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay so much. The staff were very helpful and super friendly! Location was perfect! Breakfast was great! Lots of selections. Fruits, various meats, eggs, cereal, drinks. I miss it there and was very sad to leave ):

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: antonio p
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few steps from the Rialto Bridge and a ten minutes walk brings you to S. Marco square. Location and building are excellent. Our room, albeit a little small, was very very comfortable, bathroom was clean and big. We also had a terrace with two chairs and a table. Overall we are very pleased with the accomodation. Staff was extremely corteous, both checking in and checking out. We were welcomed very warmly and found a complimentary bottle of prosecco in our room. Breakfast was good, but not the best. Wifi is available but not included, which is kind of a shame, given the high rate we were charged for the room. All in all, a great hotel with a great service and staff. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Venice - excellent concierge”
Reviews.Author: tahnee85
Reviews.Content: After a less than desirable evening in another hotel in Venice, we were lucky to find two nights available at Hotel a La Commedia (found via an expedia search) at a reasonable rate. We arrived tired and slightly disillusioned with the city however this quickly changed thanks to the friendly, efficient, professional service from the greeting concierge/reception gentleman. Although we were early (having wanted to leave our previous hotel asap), we were informed that the room was ready and furthermore, had been ungraded to a junior suite! We were escorted to our room and luggage was quickly sent up with a friendly porter. The room was spacious with a balcony large enough for an outdoor setting, the bathroom was also large and spotlessly clean. The bed was comfortable and an indoor dining setting in addition to armchair made the room extremely comfortable. The concierge further proved his worth with excellent restaurant and transport recommendations. The Hotel seems to be quite small (no restaurant/room service, a small bar) however it punches above its weight in certain ways such as the room appointments and amenities and certainly the service provided by staff and is exceptional value for money. The hotel's location is excellent, around the corner from Rialto bridge and numerous restaurants and sights including the markets. Although the area is quite busy during the day and early evening, the rooms are completely soundproofed and air conditioning is extremely efficient.

Reviews.Title: “EXCEPTIONAL SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: pupepause
Reviews.Content: Okay, Venice is expensive---get over it!!!! It is also amazing--nothing like it!!! This hotel is in a great location 10 min from almost anything. We can't say enough about the exceptional service of the Hotel---especially the front desk---make sure you ask for Andrea or Lorenzo as they will make your stay perfect. Our room was larger than we expected with a sitting area and a balcony. (3rd floor). We were very pleased with all aspects of the room. Since Venice is a walking town and outside below was an outdoor cafe we could hear people from time to time at night but no big deal. The breakfast was included and delicious. While we were visiting Italy decided to have a train STRIKE the day we were scheduled to take the train to St. Moritz, Switzerland. It was a must for us to be in St. Moritz the following morning. It was an all day train ride with three transfers to St. Mortiz. There were no rental cars in Venice, and the front desk spent well over an hour with us finding alternate avenues. They were able to secure us a limo service to take us to St. Mortiz---which is a 4.5 - 5 hour drive. Without their persistents and help our plans would have been runied and the rest of our vacation in doubt. When it was time to take the water taxi they actually took our luggage to the taxi which was quite unexpected. Bottom line: the service is beyond exceptional. Friends had recommended Hotel a la Commedia and we are glad they did---you will be too!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Suzie P
Reviews.Content: Four of us just spent a 3 day break in Venice staying at the La Commedia and we couldn't fault it. We had the standard rooms which were an excellent size and in very good decorative order, with lovely modern bathrooms (not always the case in Italy!) The staff were so helpful and easy to deal with. The breakfast was terrific and included in the price which was excellent value. The location was wonderful, just off the Grand Canal by the Rialto bridge and about 10 minutes to St Marks Square if you don't get lost! I would totally recommend this hotel for location, value and standards. Much better than many of the so called smarter hotels like the Danieli and the Gritti Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: tonyandmaryWrington
Reviews.Content: Very professional in every way. Helpful staff, lovely bedrooms and very clean. Would definitely use the hotel again and recommend it to friends. There were no negatives and it was quiet at night.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Lytham St Annes, England, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Venice in October”
Reviews.Author: Victor A
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. Ideal location from which to explore Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Lovely Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Gail D
Reviews.Content: We could not have been happier with our hotel selection. Our room was luxurious, clean and very, very comfortable. Our room had a bedroom and separate sitting room. The bathroom was lovely opposite a large closet. We also had a terrace with a lovely view. The staff was very helpful and courteous. The breakfast room was very elegant and the breakfast was lovely. There is a rooftop oasis with a bar and lounges that was a welcome respite in the afternoons after walking the beautiful city. The location was perfect. Saint Marks was a couple of minutes walk in one direction and the Rialto Bridge a couple of minutes in the other. We plan on traveling to Venice again in the very near future and would not even consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: David J
Reviews.Content: Visited Venice for 3 gorgeous days in May with my wife, keen to return and would definately use this hotel again. In addition to a great location (close to ferry stops, many of the sights and shops) the hotel staff were friendly and general standards were high. Definately consider this if heading to Venice and have only marked four instead of five stars as there were cheaper options and breakfast was a little limited. However overall we were very impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: australia2italy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very comfortable and in a convenient location. The room was lovely, although it was way too expensive. The staff were nice, but they were a bit pushy - with tours, restaurants, etc. The breakfast was very good. The room was kept very clean. It was nice to come back to this room after long days spent in this disappointing city.

Reviews.Title: “Jewel Box”
Reviews.Author: ncarmine
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. Great quiet & peaceful location, as noted before. Wonderful breakfast buffet & superior assistance from all employees at the front desk (especially Massimo...grazie). Room & bathroom were small, but squeaky clean & beautifully decorated. A terrific hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service - A Melange of notes”
Reviews.Author: Royzee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in late Sept. Venice is a fantastic city at that time of year. Hotel is very well located as noted by other reviewers. We received good directions to the hotel from the Cruise Ship port. It did take a while to get there though. Immediate help with luggage and good advice on places to eat and visit from the front desk. Lorenzo and others were very friendly - be specific on what you want & they'll give good honest answers and advice. As others have noted the "Free water taxi to the Murano Glass factory" is an arrangement to have the glass factory sell you glass. Liked the toiletries in the Bathroom - but it is "BYO Conditioner". Also no coffee maker or iron in the room. WI-Fi connection was solid. I told them I needed to be on Wi-Fi for much of the time I'd be there because I was working and they comped me 48 hours of wi-fi.Bed was not too hard but firm; AC worked and was not noisy. Room was fine- not too small not overly big either. Maybe 3 channels on the TV in English. No Workout room - but you will walk plenty in Venice. Free Breakfast was nice- serve yourself except for very good (strong) Italian Coffee . Waitstaff is professional and efficient at cleaning tables and bringing coffee. Excellent Croissants, cold cereal, yougurt and fruit, juice and breakfast bars. Really all you need. Also many great coffee and pastry places and bars within 2-3 blocks. It wasn't cheap - about $330 Euros/night. Ate a true Venetian meal at Bistro De Venice nearby one night - expensive but worth it for a treat (about 170 Euro for two with tip). There is no good pizza in Venice - we looked! But many other better options for snacks and meals. Hotel provided help with luggage and arranging a water taxi to the airport (70 euros). If the weather is nice buy an all day Vaporetto pass (16 euro) and take Vaporetto #1 up and down the Grand Canal and around the island from the Grand Rialto stop near the hotel. Hotel was very clean - public areas and your room. I'll definitely stay here again if I'm in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as we hoped”
Reviews.Author: TenBobDaveW
Reviews.Content: We had mixed feelings about this hotel. It's well located, perfect for Rialto and St Marks Square, only a few stops on the vaporetto from the bus or rail terminal (get off at Rialto stop, hotel is situated just behind, through a very narrow alley). Very clean comfortable rooms, although the beds are a little on the small side - they were too short for tall guests. We stayed at 4 star AD Place previously and the beds were huge in comparison. No information book in our room which would have been useful. Poor bathroom toiletries, bath foam in a room with only a shower for example. Lift to each floor which is a bonus in Venice. Wifi is free for 30 mins but then charged after. This is a joke in a 4 star hotel, plus the signal kept dropping. Instead, take a short walk to Devil's Forest Pub, order a drink and get the wifi code - it's free so better value than the hotel, plus it's a great little place to relax. Hotel has a 'no iron' policy meaning if you don't iron all your clothes before travelling, you'll be walking around Venice looking like you slept in them! We requested an iron from reception only to be told 'it's a Venice security policy, no irons in the hotels'. What a load of nonsense! (We had an iron at AD Place the previous year). The staff were professional enough, but not as warm as other hotels we've stayed in. We got caught out by the 'free trip to the Murano glass factory' tour, but it's actually a sales event rather than a genuine factory tour. You meet at reception, get guided to a water taxi which takes you to Murano free of charge (warning bells should have been ringing at this point - water taxis always get paid somehow!). You are met by sharp suited salesmen who take you to watch the 'masters at work' (overweight bored looking chaps with cigarettes hanging from the corners of their mouths), before being directed to the merchandise where another salesman splits the selling duties. Some of the glass is beautiful, but the prices are eye watering! In fact, you will pay a 3rd the price buying the exact same glass elsewhere - don't get conned! I appreciate this isn't the hotel, but it is the commission earning hotel staff who will push the tour to you! Anyway, back to the hotel review - breakfast is good, limited hot choice of eggs and soggy bacon, but the staff were pleasant enough. The rooftop bar was closed when we visited, but the lobby bar is a nice place to relax, with leisurely service (the barman seemed to always be elsewhere in the hotel and needed to be summoned to do his job?). We didn't dislike the hotel, but didn't love it either. It may seem picky, but this is an expensive hotel and it's the little things that count (like free wifi and ironed clothes!). There are so many hotels in Venice with those services so we won't be staying again. PS Venice is amazing, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “4 star rating? More like 5!”
Reviews.Author: Geoff R
Reviews.Content: We were both immensely impressed by the quality of your hotel, your friendly, attentive and efficient staff, the relaxing roof terrace and the central location. Although we came with friends, first time visits to a world renown city like Venice can sometimes be seen through "rose coloured glasses" and the weather was marvellous but we are experienced enough to know when we have genuinely had a great time. Thank you for a lovely holiday. We felt very relaxed very quickly. We are both sure we will return.

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay at A la Commedia every time I visit Venice.”
Reviews.Author: CEN57
Reviews.Content: Fantastic service; friendly an accommodating staff; very clean room; and perfectly located between St Mark's Square and the Rialto Bridge. It was everything we expected, and more. I'd recommend a la Commedia to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent lcation and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peta S
Reviews.Content: Finding a good value well located hotel in Venice is hard. This was expensive but definitely worth the money. Location was much better than it appeared on hotel or google maps a mere 1 min walk to main canal,2 min to rialto, 5 min to St marks (direct walking, not including window shopping....). Hotel staff very friend.y with directions and suggestions. Breakfast included to routine European fare, plus lovely fresh fruit which is always welcome relief when traveling. We caught a private taxi in from airport as we arrived at midnight, but honestly could have caught the public water taxi as the closest ferry stop is the Rialto, mind you we wouldn't have ever seen let alon known to walk down the little alley which led int the small piazza in front of hotel. There is a great little bar on rooftop. The staff speak good English. Two thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag in a Filthy Tourist Trap City”
Reviews.Author: DaBretty
Reviews.Content: First, I can't tell you enough how much Venice is a bad place to visit. It's best to just avoid and let it stay in your mind as this romantic, clean place where the people are nice. In reality it's a dump that quickly brings you to the realization as to why it's such a terrible idea to build a "city on the water" with no roads. But this review shouldn't be about Venice, so on with the hotel ... The hotel property itself is actually quite nice. Sure there are no views, but I don't think there are many views to be had in this city in the first place (as already mentioned!). The room was very expensive, but you probably already knew that when you started reading this review. But the room was very nice, very spacious. However, there's so much more to a hotel than just the room and the property ... The staff really ruined this place for us. We didn't understand the whole parking-at-the-airport, taking the bus into the train terminal area, and then getting on the dumb water bus thing to get there in advance (all our fault for not doing homework), so it took us a very long time to get there (in a heat wave of about 95 degree heat with 80% humidity). If you can picture it, we were sweaty, tired, and a bit frustrated by the difficulty one has navigating a city with no streets (and instead a hodge podge of alleys). But we finally arrive, and immediately the upselling starts. We ask about where to find the best pizza in town (not knowing that Venice is not really known for pizza). The gentleman behind the desk (an overweight Joey Fatone, you'll recognize him if you go there!) immediately breaks into an annoying sales pitch - "well, pizza in Venice is no good, you see ... I like to recommend my personal favorite restaurant ..." as he slides open a drawer with probably a couple hundred business cards all from the same restaurant. Needless to say, the hotel was getting a cut on this. Then he proceeds to tell us "perhaps you want to take a gondola ride in the canal, I will make a reservation for you with my personal favorite!", followed by "Americans love to go on a tour of the local glass making island (Murano), I will arrange a fabulous trip!" Basically, this guy didn't realize it but he was doing an anti-sales job with us. We wanted nothing to do with what he was selling us. And because you have to leave your key at the front desk (it's one of those places), you're bound to have many encounters with them trying to sell you everything. Last, before I go, let me plead one more time with you to avoid Venice altogether. There were beggars everywhere, human feces in the alleys (when a beggar's gotta go, a beggar's gotta go!), and it's an absolute nightmare to get around. All for what? There really aren't even very many things to do in Venice, unless you're really into buying touristy stuff made in China. There's no beach. The reason people go to Venice is because "it's a city on the water" and as such it's a novelty for that. But it's a bad novelty. It'd be like going on a vacation to a Turkish prison, just because it's a Turkish prison. There are far better places to go in Italy, and - better yet - there's a relatively unknown gem about 2h30m away ... Ljubljana. I can't say enough positive things about that city and that country.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: LZeisloft
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this great hotel for three days this September and had a very enjoyable stay! The service provided to us by all of the staff was welcoming and warm - nothing was left for us to worry about. The location was perfect for sightseeing, restaurants and overall exploration of Venice. The room was large by European standards, clean and appointed well. For anyone looking for friendly, attentive service this hotel fits the bill!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing haven in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Tomonewt
Reviews.Content: Beautiful bedrooms and bathrooms, great location, warm welcome from reception staff, delicious breakfast and an excellent service. What more can you ask for in a central venetian hotel? I will be recommending it to everyone thinking of staying in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel La Commedia”
Reviews.Author: Decr
Reviews.Content: Hotel La Commedia was wonderful. The staff are very very helpful and are very courteous. The hotel has been newly renovated and has beautiful clean accommodations with wonderful marble bathrooms, large beds, plenty of closet and drawer space. Conveniently situatated between Rialto bridge and San Marco Square. It is a great location. Easy to get to from the Rialto water taxi stop. I highly recommend the La Commedia hotel. It was a pleasure to stay there. They also have a very relaxing roof-top area where you can sit to read, relax, or have a drink at the roof top bar. Sarah

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: lofu93
Reviews.Content: The hotel was luxurious and super clean. We booked a standard room which was beautiful and large and the bathroom was almost as large as the room itself. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The location is great just a few steps of Rialto bridge and vaporetto and alilaguna buses and short walk from Saint Mark Basilica. Also one of our favorite restaurants Bistro Venice is located just steps away from the hotel. We booked the hotel through otel.com and had nothing but a great experience with them. We would love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel in a gorgeous city”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was pure luxury with great service and an ideal location. It was easy to find, just meters from the Grand Canal. The roof top bar was a divine place for an early evening drink and a great place to get a different perspective of Venice. The breakfast was lovely and all the staff were helpful and polite. Our room was large, comfortable and luxurious. The bathroom equally so. We would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nolaclark2
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Hotels.com, and was sure I booked the Deluxe room. I'm still sorting out what happened, but when we checked in we were given the "Classic" room. Way too small for 2 friends staying 5 days. When they moved us to the bigger room (charging 50 Euro additional per nite), we were much more comfortable. We also got hit with a 5 Euro per person, per nite tourist tax that literally went into effect the day we checked in (all hotels in Venice will now be charging this). The hotel itself is very nice, located near St. Mark's. The desk staff were all very helpful, making dinner reservations, and patiently directing us by map to the areas we wished to explore. One gentleman, Lorenzo, stood out as particularly helpful to us. The breakfast was included in the rate, and was the expected breads, meats, cheeses, etc found in Europe. The gentleman serving coffee and tea in the dining area was very welcoming. The room was very clean, and the air conditioner was Wonderful during the intense August heatwave that Italy experienced! We did go to the rooftop bar on a a few nights. Because of the heatwave, it did not appear many hotel occupants were using it. The view is lovely there, and there are tables, double seated chaise, etc. A nice amenity at the hotel, but empty. Apparently, only guests may visit the rooftop bar...we were the only 2 people there at nite. Lucio and David who work the bar, were professional, and helpful giving suggestions of places in Venice we may not have seen otherwise...Thanks, Guys! Our single concern was that the man who refills the mini bar never knocked or rang the bell, rather just unlocking the door and walking in on 2 separate occasions. We did mention it to the front desk. Overall, this was an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accommodation in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Wesley and Laur... H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel A La Commedia for 2 nights to celebrate a special occasion. It was a perfect setting in a very special city. We cannot fault the hotel in any way from the friendly staff who will do anything to help you to the magnificent standard of the room. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We went back - it was just as good”
Reviews.Author: ShoeburynessHilda
Reviews.Content: It's in Venice, we've been four times in two years, that says it all. A former theatre modernised into a lovely boutique hotel. Clean, comfortable and friendly with a rear alley leading to the Rialto Bridge. Oh! and a roof terrace bar with sun loungers. But don't tell anyone or you won't get in next time you want to book as they will all want to go!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel & excellent location”
Reviews.Author: blondegeek
Reviews.Content: The only reason this doesn't rate an excellent is because my husband didn't care for the beds (just a little too firm, and the pillows too flat)! Otherwise, an excellent, EXCELLENT location - so close to the Grande Canal and Rialto Bridge, as well as a number of fabulous restaurants. Also, a great rooftop lounge, perfect for celebrating with some new friends (no food is served, just a bar). Gorgeous gold motif - big rooms, lovely view. Bathroom also very large and modern. Not on the canal, which is probably a benefit in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “MAGNIFICENT AND SO PROFESSIONAL”
Reviews.Author: DominicBathEngland
Reviews.Content: This is my Venice hotel from now on.It has everything going for it. In a city where a single water bus ride costs Â£6 it helps to be in walking distance of the major sights. The hotel is just around the corner,in a quiet spot ,from the Rialto bridge and bus stop. It has been renovated . Bedrooms are opulent with crisp linen and superb marble bathrooms. A stunning bonus is a roof top bar ,tranquil in a busy city .All staff were impressive but Signor Lorenzo B on the front desk could hold a job down at Claridges or the Carlyle. Full of wisdom.The gentleman who ran the bar and breakfast room was incredibly kind and rustled up a large sandwich for one of my boys who had been feeling unwell earlier but recovered his appetite at 10pm.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: albatros63
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the end of our two week intense trip to Italy. It was so wonderfully relaxed, it made us giddy. We were really looking for a quite place to stay and we couldn't have found a better hotel. Slightly tucked in, away from St Marco's square, quite and clean, it gave us the best finish. The staff was incredibly nice, consierge's rwcommenndations for dinners were outstanding, breakfasts at the hotels were perfect and we enjoyed every moment of it. Would go back any time ....

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, service and location”
Reviews.Author: AddyA
Reviews.Content: Once we had trekked on hot, cobbled streets with our suitcases; we were overwhelmed with the outstanding welcome, our room ready before time and a cool spotless hotel. It is easy to find anywhere from this location, but you are more than pleased to find your way back again. A wonderful touch is that after you had visited your room and messed it up a bit then gone out; on your return, it had been tidied up again, the bed turned down and sweets left with the next days weather report on your bed. We just loved snoozing with a cold glass of wine on the roof terrace in the afternoon, just heavenly, and the loungers are imaginative- makes you feel like a child again. Any negatives? Just one- the film on tv is on a loop and 'pirates of the caribbean' was on constantly, otherwise you had news. Only a small irritation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service - we would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: IQ140
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel near the Rialto stop. A bit expensive but everything in Venice is expensive - at 300 euros for a deluxe room, probably in the middle of the range for hotels within easy walk of St. Marco. The decor/design is sort of traditional elegant yet modern. Room and bath were very nice with a super shower (no water shortage here). Everything was immaculate. Only problem was a couple of electrical outlets that were finicky or not working at all. Nice rooftop terrace and bar. Breakfast buffet was very good with a reasonable selection of hot and cold foods, although not as extensive as some other hotels on our trip, and very efficient waiters. Free wifi was only for 30 minutes but you can buy cheaper wifi through Venice Connected that works along the Grand and certain spots, like St. Marc square. Front desk was very polite, helpful with restaurant suggestions and reservations and even arranged a shared gondola ride with another couple at 20 euros less than the going rate if we had gone alone. By the way, even though 60 -80 euros or more for a 40 minute gondola trip may seem high, this is something not to be missed. The perspective from a gondola is unique. At about 6 or 6:30 pm, the Grand Canal traffic is quieter, although you want a circuit that goes mainly in the little canals and perhaps only a short stretch on the Grand anyway. We would recommend this hotel to friends and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: BECMATTManchester
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from Venice staying at this hotel - it was lovely - the roof top bar was so nice and relaxing with large loungers to chill in - the room were very elegant and spotless clean, very comfortable. The breakfast room was small but nice buffet - we would stay there again if we go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice Venetian get-away”
Reviews.Author: CA_Jayhawk
Reviews.Content: For past Venice trips, I've stayed at Westin's Europa Regina (always looking for Starwood points). This trip, however, the Westin was full and the other Starwood properties were too ritzy for a business trip. So, I tried the Hotel a La Commedia. It's literally around the corner from the Rialto bridge, with the main entrance on a small square. So many Venice hotels seem to be going for a quirky and charming feel (due to their old buildings and plumbing). This one is more polished â€” less old-world character, but more sophistication The rooms are quite small, but very well appointed. The bathrooms in particular are well above European hotel standards in design and fittings. There is some street noise, but probably no more than other hotels. One of the best hotel features is the sunny rooftop deck bar. It's quiet with tables and lounges and you'll have a panorama of nearby rooftops. To reach the hotel from the airport, you can save some money and take the public waterbus (orange line). It will drop you VERY close to the hotel (Rialto stop) , so you won't be hauling luggage very far. It's only 15 euro vs. the private taxi which can be 100.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Staff were excellent”
Reviews.Author: TravelTrollKent
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Venice, and my wife and I chose a different hotel for this trip. We chose this Hotel based on its good reviews, and were not disappointed. Throughout our stay we found the staff to be friendly and very helpful. The rooms were very clean and well furnished with adequate storage space. Very quiet , with no disturbances. Bathroom was spacious and clean. Breakfast was good, but it can get very crowded at certain times. We usually had a nightcap on the roof terrace in the evening. Very relaxing after a day out, and a nice way to round off the evening. The hotel location was excellent, being easy walking distance for all main shopping, the Rialto and St. Marks Square. Not far to drag suitcases from/to the water taxis at the Rialto. A very pleasant stay in a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LTWM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my mother for two nights in May. We booked directly with the hotel via email and great service began from there. Emails were sent back and forth with quick responses from Lorenzo. He even remembered my name when we checked-in. We arrived at Marco Polo Airport, from there we took the public waterbus Alilaguna orange line to the Rialto Line 1 stop. The hotel was literally only a few minutes walk away, absolutely wonderful for 2 females with 3 luggages. Their website has directions. Location was perfect, minutes walk to the Rialto Bridge and maybe 10mins to St. Mark's Square. It was very hot so hotel was very convenient for us to return for breaks during the day. One of the main reasons why I chose this hotel besides the location is because it has a lift/elevator, not just stairs! Staff were wonderful. Room was beautiful, we stayed in a room which had a separate lounge area. Very spacious even if it didn't have a lounge area. Turn down service is twice a day. Marble bathroom is a good size with great shower. Buffet breakfast had a great selection, it's cold breakfast which is the norm in Venice/Italy. Yes it's very pricey but coming from Sydney Australia and travelling with my mother, it was her first and maybe her only trip to Venice, it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pedalkath
Reviews.Content: Although not overlooking the grand canal, this hotel this hotel was very convenient and easy to find. Just a few yards from Rialto Bridge and turn down a small alleyway and it is there in front of you! Even we did not get lost finding the hotel, although we did manage to get "mislaid" a few times in Venice itself! We were in Venice for 7 days to celebrate our Golden Wedding Anniversary. The hotel - very quiet, and exceptionally clean. The continental breakfast selection was very good. Only waited a couple of times for a table, but not for long. The hotel should employ more staff in the breakfast room (restaurant) as the staff there were rather rushed off their feet, but in any case did a grand job We had a de-luxe room which was very good, we had moved to a junior suite but moved straight back into de-luxe room. The suite was not what I would class as a suite. It just had a larger entrance hall. But the . De-luxe Room excellent. Still wonder whether we should have booked a hotel with Grand Canal frontage and restaurant for dinner, or did we do right with this hotel which was quiet and clean. It would be too much to expect everything to be perfect with hotels.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, well situated”
Reviews.Author: patsy67
Reviews.Content: Following other "TA" reviews. The hotel is in a the Rialto district of Venice just back from the Grand Canal. We found the rooms beautifully furnished with quiet and efficient air conditioning which was very welcome as the temperature out side was in the 80F. The hotel could be improved by tea and coffee equipment making in the rooms, we got round this by taking our kettle etc and the fridge was large enough to store milk. Although the reception staff were polite but perhaps somewhat unfriendly, not sure if it was because we refused the offer of the trip to Murano and the shared gondola ride. Breakfast was ok but have had more variety at other hotels and quite often we had to ask for jugs of juice or the basket with the croissants to be refilled and the service was slow and the staff forgetful. The staff seem to multi task, one day waitering, next security,and another day reception duty. Venice is expensive but many resturants have a tourist menu and there are plenty of sandwich bars. Obviously Venice in July is crowded and hot but didn't smell as we thought it might and we never saw a mozzie but lots of people had bites on legs and arms. We used the water bus from the airport and traghetti to cross the canal, these were quick and inexpensive. Overall we would recommend the hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in class”
Reviews.Author: Mxmsvchnk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my wife for two nights in July 2011. It was wonderful time being in comfortable and well designed room which in real life is just the same (and even better) than on fotos on web site with a good air condition system. Location is perfect for sightseeing. Very friendly and helpul staff, especially Mr. Lorenzo made a lot for us to keep our stay very pleasant there. Really one of the best hotels we lived in Italy in that class and should be recommended. Open terrase on the 4-th floor is the right place to spend a couple of relaxing hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nisha14
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic! The hotel itself is beautiful, breakfast is excellent and the service is over the top. The front desk recommended and booked amazing restaurants for us, printed off and highlighted the train schedule for our next leg, booked a gondola ride and even found us a tour guide who took us on a private tour of Venice. When we left, they helped us with our (multiple) bags and dragged them to the water taxi stand for us. This was a great place to stay in Venice and we would definitely go back! A big thank you to all the staff for being so wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and the hotel - would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: RuthDettman
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, clean and located in the perfect spot! We received a lot of good advice on check in on the best places to go visit with our limited time in Venice (two days). The hotel was in a great location and we were only a few minutes away from both the Rialto Bridge and San Marco. The rooftop bar looked great but it was raining while we were there so unfortunately were not able to enjoy the view from up top. Breakfast was included and the buffet was extensive - cooked breakfast, cereals, cold meats/cheeses, yogurt and fruit. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: SueKenC
Reviews.Content: Hotel a la Commedia is a wonderful place to stay if you are visiting Venice. It is a two minute walk from the Rialto waterbus stop and although it is so centrally located, it still provides a wonderfully peaceful place to unwind after a long day of exploring the sights. The roof terrace was the icing on the cake...a cold gin and tonic, the aerobatics of the swallows at dusk and a gorgeous view over the pantiles of the city made for a truly memorable holiday. Our room was spotlessly clean and well appointed, and the staff were friendly, welcoming and helpful. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff, and location!”
Reviews.Author: JetSetterM
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our Italy trip. We stayed 2 nights at the Commedia. It was GREAT!!!!! The location was perfect and everything was clean and excellent! The front desk staff were very friendly and had great suggestions for food, tours, etc. Florian was really nice also, he was bartending. The only bad thing was that the rooftop terrace was not open because it was a little rainy, but that was not the hotelâ€™s fault. Breakfast was also good and was a great start to the day. The coffee and milk were AWESOME! TIP: When you come out of the hotel there is a little restaurant to the left. I think it is called El Colombo (or something like that). If you are looking at the restaurant behind it, to the right there is a little alley. If you go through the alley you will pop out RIGHT AT RIALTO!!!! I only wish that we found this sooner!

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Cindyann55
Reviews.Content: We researched many hotels before our trip to Venice. We selected the Hotel La Commedia based to some degree on Trip Advisor reviews that we read but also on our personal research. We LOVED this hotel! It absolutely could not have been any better. We were greeted with such friendliness upon our arrival and shown immediately to our wonderful room. As we were traveling with our adult daughter we had a junior suite and it was more than large enough for the three of us with room to spare. The bathroom was luxuriously large and we loved the large, thick towels. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and more than enough to satisfy our tastes. Our room was well appointed and very comfortable. The location of this hotel, as mentioned in previous reviews, is perfect. Only a short 8 or so minute walk to St. Mark's and the Doge's Palace one direction and just steps from the Grand Canal and the Rialto Bridge in the other direction. It's very quiet and away from the huge crowds, something we truly appreciated. If I may say a word about Lorenzo at the front desk. What a treasure he was, and such a help to us! If you go, listen to his restaurant recommendations - they were spot on and just exactly what we were looking for each of our three nights. The hotel also offers transportation to Murano and a tour of a glass factory. We did this and were extremely happy we did. We were NOT pressured in any way at the factory to buy and very much enjoyed the tour. If we are ever fortunate enough to go back to Venice we would never consider staying anywhere else. If you are traveling to Venice, do yourself a favor and select this hotel. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and will be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: kidman20
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a great Botique Hotel in Venice someplace close to the Grand Canal but not directly in front of it for the noise issue. We found Hotel a La Commedia and counted ourselves very lucky. The location is fantastic, just a few meters from the Grand Canal on a beautiful side street. The hotel itself is very clean, great size rooms and attention to detail. The breakfast was mainly Amercian style, eggs, cereal, etc. However, it was the staff that really won our hearts. Everyone from the in- room service to the servers to the front desk Clerks. They were friendly, helpful and a well of knowledge. Roberto M. is the BEST!!!!!
