He suggested and arrange tours for us(we really enjoyed the group Gondola ride). He also had our Water Taxi waiting for us to the Airport. Love this place and all of it's staff.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless stay”
Reviews.Author: lowfields
Reviews.Content: An excellent three-night stay in Venice at La Commedia, which was perfectly located, spotlessly clean and staffed by extremely helpful, courteous staff. Absolutely no complaints and would not only stay again, but recommend it to others for a good value and extremely comfortable visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fab location”
Reviews.Author: treasures-sjw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, quaint and has some really nice personal touches. Staff are friendly, location excellent. Breakfast is good too with a fair selection of cheeses, meats, bread and cereals etc. Good value for money, would certainly stay here again. Although make sure you pop into the Danelli hotel for a drink, you really do experience the wow factor here, although at a hefty price!

Reviews.Title: “AN EXCELLENT CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: FATPIKE
Reviews.Content: When you read through the other reports most things have been said to form an opinion that this is a very good hotel. Location, spotlessly clean, helpful staff, good breakfast, some nice room amenities all score highly in the reports. I wont go on with the superlatives this is an excellent choice and you won't go far wrong choosing this hotel. Tips have been offered throughout these reports and forums however i offer a couple to you which may go to re-enforce what's been said before or as a reminder, should you be travelling in the near future. The Grand Canal is less than 2 minutes walk from the hotel if you are arriving from the airport used the Orange line Aliaguna water bus its 25 Euro return and stops at the Rialto the walk is about 200 mtrs to the hotel. To see the Grand Canal on a budget buy a 12 hour pass( 16E) and sit on the No 1 water bus it tours the Grand Canal and takes in each stop eventually taking you to the Lido you can stay on and return and see the canal again. You can use this pass to take you the the Islands as well as all the Venice area its great value. If you have the time take the LN to Burano you won't be disappointed. Back to the hotel -- All the staff were extremely helpful and i would especially like to thank Lorenzo, his personal attributes are exemplary, his knowledge and willingness to assist us at every opportunity made our stay so much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly positioned”
Reviews.Author: NoraNJtoLondon
Reviews.Content: Seeing Venice in only a few days is very simple when staying at a La Commedia. It is about 2 minutes from the Rialto Bridge and maybe 5 minutes or so from San Marco. If you get tired of walking, the Rialto vaporeto stop is very close, making it wasy to go up and down the canal. The rooms were clean, spacious and nicely appointed. I especially liked the Etro bath products. The breakfast was nicely organized and food was plentiful. The men at the front desk were very helpful with getting us oriented. The hotel will help organize gondola rides (either 30 euro per person shared with 2 other couples or 120 for one couple and no sharing). Ours was a lot of fun and much less cheesy than I had expected. The hotel also organizes a free taxi to Murano. Of course, you are obligated to check out one glass factory for a few minutes, but it was still a convenient way to get to Murano quickly. Our 3 nights here were very enjoyable, and I would love to stay here again when we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, exceptional value proposition”
Reviews.Author: gamze68
Reviews.Content: We spent the easter vacation at a La Commedia. When I tarvel to Europe unless I stay at a 5 star hotel, i always keep my expectations very low. But this hotel was a miracle. A very goosd sized room, very tastefully decorated, newly refurbished with all the necessary amenities. I felt that the service was 5 star. The staff were so helpful and nice. It did not have much of a common area to sit and relax but somewhere like Venice one spends very ittle time at the hotel so it did not not really matter much. The location is also great, 5 minutes from St Marco Square. I wouls strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: caspervr
Reviews.Content: Our Christmas in Venice was magical with the help of this hotel! Some general notes: -The staff was incredible! Very friendly and helpful. Got us discounts at restaurants and pointed us to the best shops. The bartender in the main lobby was a lot of fun too. -Rooms were cozy and clean. Great marble bathrooms with big mirrors. -Free breakfast was a great value. Fruit, granola, oatmeal, toast, breakfast bars, etc. for free and a small additional fee for made-to-order eggs/meat. -Perfect location! Near the Gran Canal, Rialto Bridge, and a short walk to St. Mark's square. -The only downside was that internet access was very pricey. I recommend going to a cafe instead for a better deal

Reviews.Title: “Impressive! An absolute delight...”
Reviews.Author: Avataarkaap
Reviews.Content: This was definitely the find of the holiday for us. Good price, good location, good service. Quite close to perfection for a romantic holiday in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Stellar service”
Reviews.Author: PaulTT
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the name "commedia'. They take their business seriously. This hotel is extremely well run. The staff could not have been more kind and helpful. The rooms are sumptuously designed. The breakfast room is well managed and the breakfast good. We paid when we booked months ago and when we arrived we were upgraded to a Suite. Magnificent. Highest compliments to this fine Venice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lc1Plymouth
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel - we got upgraded to a junior suite room which was gorgeous. The hotel is in a great location and was so easy to find when we first arrived as only a 2 minute walk from the Rialto Vaperetto stop. Centrally located so St Marks about a 5 minute walk away. The staff were brilliant and the breakfast was good. So quiet at night too! We will definitely return to this hotel. 10 out of 10!

Reviews.Title: “A top quality hotel in the perfect location to enjoy Venice”
Reviews.Author: jamesgoggin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is seconds away from the Rialto Bridge in a secluded location that is close to the heart of Venice. The hotel is 4 star plus and it fully deserves that rating.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing as always”
Reviews.Author: eiljwor
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Venice, Hotel La Commedia, a birthday treat from my husband, This is my 6th visit to this Hotel, and it just gets better and better. As always the room was impeccable, staff were efficient but friendly, and always helpful. The breakfast room is inviting with an excellent buffett and good italian coffee. The standard is extremely high and having experienced this hotel now 6 times, I will not stay any where else. My thanks to all staff for making my birthday celebration special. See you in December.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: OPJ101
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 very comfortable and happy days at this hotel. The rooms are super-cosy and clean, the bathrooms large and lavish, the location perfect and the acoustic sound proofing very good. We were also very impressed with the attentive and enthusiastic front desk staff who seemed extra keen to help with directions and suggestions whenever they could (Massimo is particularly charming and helpful!). The only slight disappointment for me was the absence of a gym and the bedrooms were a touch small but other than that this place is bennissimo!!

Reviews.Title: “What a treat, it made our vacation great!”
Reviews.Author: TaraLA78
Reviews.Content: we are a party of 5 so we were given a triple and a double room....both were impeccably posh, well thought out and clean. Great location a short walk from the Rialto Bridge. Easy to find also, the last thing you want to do after a long flight is to search through a strange city looking for your hotel. Close to St Marks Square. Close to water taxi's. The breakfast is incredible....great variety, I'm sorry I didn't get a picture. You won't be disappointed. It was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - made our stay in Venice perfect”
Reviews.Author: Burnsie1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in a triple room and really cannot fault the hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful no matter what our query was. They were great with directions and could arrange trips at very reasonable prices. Room was spacious, very comfortable & bathroom was huge. Breakfast was lovely, freshly prepared every day. Location is excellent - couple of minutes from the Rialto on the Grand Canal & a slightly longer walk through lots of lovely little streets to St Marks. Could not have been in a better place and I would definitely want to stay here when I visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service, clean, comfortable rooms, nicely decorated”
Reviews.Author: jfhills
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights. We found the staff to be extremly friendly and helpful with everything. Roberto M and the staff at the front desk offered suggestion for us, took care of dinner reservations, water taxis, gondola ride appointments and was more then happy to answer any questions we had. In addition this hotel is in a great location. Near the grand canal and the Rialto bridge and only minutes from S t Marks square. The hotel is very clean, nicely decorated and updated. Tthe rooms and the bathroom were a good size. We had a triple room. It was a very nice stay and I would recomend this hotel. We went to Florence and Rome after this and did not receive the same quality of friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “What a Fantastic Hotel,Brilliant Location,Superb Staff,Just cant be beaten!”
Reviews.Author: greenjacket999
Reviews.Content: Went her on 18th March 2011 for my wifes birthday on the 20th, I was totally blown away at the quality of the Hotel. everything from the moment you walk into reception to the place is quality and styl, the staff polite and helpful and nothing is too much bother, breakfast is top quality and lots of it! We were given advice as to where and where not to go to try and keep costs down in a city where a cup of coffee can cost you Â£5! We will without doubt return here again safe in the knowledge that for a very good price we will be staying in one of the very very best hotels in Venice...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent service, lovely large comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: viczmb_21
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I stayed for three nights in this hotel in March 2011. We got the water bus from the airport and got off at the Rialto stop. We had no map and saw a labrynth of streets ahead of us. But to our surprise the hotel was about a 3 minute walk down from the Rialto stop and very easy to find. Excellent location! First impressions of this hotel were very good. Reception area and bar/lounge area are very smart as are the staff who were very welcoming. We were shown to our room by a Porter who again was very helpful and what a lovely surprise our room was. It was absolutely massive, had a huge very comfortable queen size bed, huge bathroom and a large private sun terrace with a table and chairs so that we could sit outside and soak up the Venetian sun. We later ventured to St Mark's square which was only a 5 minute walk away. The following morning we sampled the hotel breakfast which was absolutely delicious. The usual cold meats and cheeses as well as cereals, croissants and fresh fruit which was so fresh and much tastier than some other hotels I have stayed in (in Paris and Rome). The hot chocoate was very tasty! You also have the option to have a hot breakfast made to order which I think included fried, scrambled or poached eggs (there were several options but I didnt even consider them as hotel breakfast was tasty enough). We had a fantastic stay at the Hotel a la Commedia and we will definitely be returning there in the future. Thank you to all the staff there for making our weekend so special.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: greatshoes
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a week and has an amazing time. fantastic location.the hotel was lovely and although the rooms were small , were perfectly comfortable with a lovely bathroom. breakfast was continental had a good choice . staff were very friendly. Venice is very expensive but did find many small bars that were very reasonable , though you need to walk and get lost many times to find them. That was part of the fun. Did worry that a week would be to long but really could have stayed for a few more days

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Service to Match”
Reviews.Author: patully
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was perfect. Yards from the Grand Canal and a 2 minute walk to St Marks Square. The staff were all very friendly and extremely knowledgeable - they will help you with any possible excursions to the islands and can organise Gondola rides (although you can get these cheaper yourself). Our room was great, always kept immaculately clean and we enjoyed the chocolates each night left on our bed. The only gripe would be the hardness of our pillows. Overall - perfect location, perfect service and perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel - great value”
Reviews.Author: Mike-Anne
Reviews.Content: We really loved this hotel. The location was so convenient just two minutes to Rialto and 10 minutes to St Mark's. Easy to reach from the airport by Alilaguna [orange], so no need for exorbitant water taxi. The hotel is very recently modernised, everything works perfectly and it is perfect for holidays since there are few facilities for business-people. Booking with Citalia the price was fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: IM60
Reviews.Content: We went to Venice for a birthday celebration and stayed 3 nights here. The hotel was well positioned very near to Rialto Bridge and St Mark's Sq, the room decor was beautiful and scrupulously clean and the bathroom was superb, again immaculate. Staff were friendly and my husband's birthday cards were noted and resulted in a card and biscuits from the management - a nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, (but a small minus)”
Reviews.Author: Nordkvinnen
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the heart of Venice, near Rialto. Close to water-taxi stop. Wonderful roof terrace for those hot summer days, but closed in February. Clean and nice rooms, looking exactly like the ones at their website. Very friendly staff. Ok breakfast. So why only 4 out of 5? They charge 8 â‚¬ pr. hour for access to wifi, which is free on most hotels these days. Not worthy a 4 star hotel! If you do not need or want a wifi-connection, there are nothing negative about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Delighted with our choice”
Reviews.Author: IainP57
Reviews.Content: Having spent many hours reviewing hotels in Venice on the Tripadvisor site, we decided on Hotel La Commedia for our family visit in December. We were not disappointed. We had previously arranged a private water taxi from the airport and were dropped off at a jetty not far from the Rialto Bridge. The hotel was between 50 - 100 metres from the jetty and also very close to many lovely shops, including the only Department store in Venice and lots of cafes and restaurants. All of the staff were very courteous, pleasant and very helpful with our numerous queries. The rooms were clean, beautifully furnished, well maintained and (very importantly) nice and warm as the weather was cold for the duration of our stay and snowed in the middle of our visit). Judging from the dining room at breakfast time, the hotel was pleasantly busy during our stay. Only one morning we had to wait for a table for four, but that was down to selfish couples sitting at tables for 4 as there were spare tables for 2. I see from some previous reviews that some people weren't happy that cooked breakfast was an additional cost, but the buffet was more than enough for each of us in our party (various cold meats, cheeses, hard boiled eggs, fruit salad, fresh fruits, rolls, croissants and a nice (but very sweet) almond tart. Whilst there were only 2 waiting staff, they made a good job of replenishing teas, coffees and the buffet itself. By the second day we had acquainted ourselves of the San Marco area and, whilst distances seemed further on the map, it was only taking us around 7 minutes to get from the hotel to St Mark's Square if we were running late for dinner, but longer on the way back when window shopping in preparation for the shopping expedition the next day! On our departure we could have taken the Vaporetto to the airport but decided to take the water taxi again. The hotel booked it for us and it picked us up from the Vaporetto stop as the jetty was still very snowed up. It was more than 30 years since I had last been to Venice and I can't wait to go back again. When I return I certainly plan to stay at La Commedia again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, efficient, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: MikeS00
Reviews.Content: A couple of minutes from the Rialto, direct link to airport and vaporetto services in the city. Beautifully furnished and maintained rooms and particularly good bathroon.Pleasant staff, standard Italian breakfast. And good value, certainly on my Citalia package.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice, absolutely lovely”
Reviews.Author: jerseybean50
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Venice for a special birthday and after reading lots of reviews about all sorts of hotels, decided to book the A La Commedia. We took a private water taxi from the airport as there was a group of 4 travelling and the departure time of the Alilaguna boat meant that we would have had to wait 40-45 minutes for the boat and then make a number of stops on the way to the Rialto which at this time of the year in the freezing cold is not a good idea. We paid 100 euros which I must say I didn't think was bad as within 15 minutes or so we were at the landing stage at the bottom of the little alley that leads directly to the hotel and which is probably only 80 - 100 yards away from the canal. The hotel is a great choice in terms of position, minutes from the Rialto Bridge and by the time we were due to leave we had found a way through to St Marco which took us 5 minutes (at night) although during the day a lot longer due to window shopping and menu reading outside establishments. The hotel was spotlessly clean, the rooms were lovely, all decorated in shades of cream and gold with canopies over the beds and choices of lighting from the tiniest of reading lights through to canopy, overhead and table lamps either separately or all together. There was plenty of hanging and shelf space, desk space and a small table and armchairs if you wanted to take your breakfast in your room. A nice large bed and although I am definitely a duvet person the blanket was not too heavy and there was spare pillows and blankets in the cupboard. There is a C.D. player in the room, hairdryer in the bathroom and a minibar and whilst there was no Wifi in the room it was not a problem for us as ours was a social visit and not business. We couldn't increase the temperature in our room but as soon as we told the reception that we had a problem they were able to confirm that the room temperature did not match the figure that we had requested as they have some way of reviewing it in the reception. When we came back in the evening it had been resolved and the room was really very warm. Breakfast every morning was just great, I don't hold with the need for bacon and eggs etc, after all this was Italy and a continental breakfast done well is a nice way to start the day. I actually found the choice of food excellent, there were 3 types of cereal, a couple of juices plus large jugs of water and milk. There were hard boiled eggs, at least 6 types of cheese, speck, mortadella and ham as well as brown or white bread rolls, 2 types of croissant and biscuits for cheese etc. or sweet biscuits. Assorted fruits were available either as a fresh fruit salad, pineapple and kiwi plus a large tray of apples, bananas and oranges. Yoghurts, marmalade, jams, honey and Nuttella spread were also on the buffet. The service in the dining room was immpeccable, the 2 members of staff kept the table filled and served you with as much tea, coffee and chocolate as you wanted. When they found out it was my birthday a small gift was even forthcoming. The reception staff were friendly and welcoming and the bar was very cosy. It was a great choice and thanks to the people that posted their reviews and pictures. Would I stay there again, yes without a doubt, I loved the area which was so central for everything that we wished to do. Having stayed previously closer to St Marks square, I much prefered the position of the A La Commedia which gave quick access to San Polo and Dorsoduro as well as Castello and Canneregio. We had no view from the room but then as we were so seldom in it it did not matter at all. Do stay here I promise you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and top quality hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: ChocolateScottsdale
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel a la Commedia for three nights in early November. After two long flights and train trip to Venice, we were very pleased that we had chosen this fine hotel. The vaporetti stop at Rialto is only a few hundred feet from the hotel. The location is perfect, quiet yet convenient to all the sites from Rialto to San Marco. This is a perfect couples hotel. The room was beautifully furnished; bedding was nice quality, the bathroom was elegant marble. Breakfast was very nice, a comfortable room and refined staff. We loved our stay at this hotel. This hotel is one of Venice's hidden treasures.

Reviews.Title: “You have to pay for your internet connection!”
Reviews.Author: Cagliano
Reviews.Content: We've been there for 1 day last weekend. Everything was fine. Hotel, Room, location, kindness at the reception.. Everything. The only spoil in this beautiful hotel is that they ask you 5â‚¬ for 30 min. of internet connection!!! This is crazy!

Reviews.Title: “Great in all details”
Reviews.Author: BiagiodiMaratea
Reviews.Content: We have spent four nights in this hotel. In all details it's very good: it's clean, rooms are very comfortable and well equipped, spacious bathroom, services are good, the staff is friendly and helpful. A good example is the weatherforcast you will get in your room every evening on a small card. Good breakfast as well, and the hotel is very quiet. Good roof terrace to bask in the sun and to have a drink. Good value for money, although it's (of course, after all it's Venice) not a cheap hotel. For sure we will return here.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Drumman48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to Venice on our honeymoon. From the moment we stepped into the hotel till we checked out, it was such a great experience. The staff was incredibly helpful, friendly, and even served up a joke or two at the front desk. The room was adequate, the breakfast was filling and had a good variety of things to chose from and the upstairs bar had a great selection of drinks. I have stayed in 5 star hotels who were not as nice as this hotel. This is a must stay if your travel plans include Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Carlmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Commedia three nights in early October. Two minutes from Rialto Vaparatto stop. Staff was excellent, room (Junior Suite) was very nice, and breakfast was really good. We could walk to St. Marks Square and many excellent restaurants. Hotel was very quiet being so close to such a high traffic area (Rialto Bridge) We will stay there again on our next trip. Too many positives to consider any place else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: ZombieChief
Reviews.Content: We stayed at A La Commedia for 5 nights and was very impressed with their attentive and congenial customer service, both at the front desk and throughout the hotel. The hotel is very conveniently located near a Vaporetto (water bus) stop and the Rialto Bridge. The breakfast buffet at the hotel was spectacular and there are a number of excellent nearby restaurants. For a quick meal with ambiance, it is an easy stroll to the banks of the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: Fredgolfer
Reviews.Content: Reception staff very pleasent. This hotel is in a good location for all the sites and shoppin. Transfer from airport but water bus is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great, lovely central spot”
Reviews.Author: sarahcWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while travelling around Italy on our honeymoon. The hotel was in a great central location, just near the Rialto. Our junior suite was spacious, clean and traditionally decorated. The breakfast was not the best we experienced but was more than adequate nonetheless. We particularly enjoyed the roof terrace bar which was just perfect for a pre- or post-dinner drink!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MMcK-10
Reviews.Content: From start to finish this short break was a dream come true. Hotel made it all the more perfect. Really central and easilty located using water bus from station. Staff second to none and cleanliness, decor and comfort of the hotel very impressive (considering price). Venice is a city I will never forget. Be care of the mosquitos (even in November).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect city break hotel: central location, rooftop bar, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: TechieLady
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect hotel for a city break. It's right in the centre of Vence, five minutes to the water bus stop for the airport; 10 minutes very picturesque walk to the Piazza San Marco and right in the middle of a great shopping area - couldn't be more convenient. The rooms are nicely appointed in a traditional style with lovely marble bathrooms and hot fast shower. Ours was on the 4th floor and quiet. I as usual had a laptop with me and mobile internet, so not sure about wireless internet. I was never disturbed while working. Mobile connectivity was ok though. Continental breakfast is included. I only had bread and coffee - both nice. Staff are lovely and helpful. We arrived late and the person on reception suggested Bar Jazz for a late drink and snack and it was great. They suggested interesting restaurants and activities - even when they didn't arrange, they let us know the right price for a gondola trip, for example. A hidden gem is the rooftop bar, which has fabulous panoramic views and some great furniture. See my pic. Basically, I couldn't fault the hotel. Everything was perfect and when it wasn't - I asked them to fix the hairdryer - they put it righ straight away. This is the nicest place I have stayed for a long time and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: NigelTufnell
Reviews.Content: Located just a couple of minutes from the Rialto Bridge and Grand Canal this hotel is in the perfect place in Venice. The room we stayed in was amazing. Very very spacious, super clean and the bathroom was marbled perfection. There is also a roof-top terrace which looks out on the city. Perfect for a drink to watch the sunset before heading out in the evening. Breakfast was included in the price of the room and was a simple continental breakfast or cereal. Location for shopping is great also. Plus there are two cash points and a nice bakery next to the hotel. The staff even got us a discounted Gondola trip which was nice. Only qualm would be the price ($200 a night). Lucky we only stayed one night! One bit of advice, if you park in Tronchetto get the number 2 river bus to the Rialto Bridge stop. DonÂ´t get off at Piazza San Marco like we did as its about a ten minute walk through the maze of streets crowded with tourists (annoying if you have suitcases!).

Reviews.Title: “At the top of its game, the best 4 star Hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Rutland555
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here last week for 4 days and we loved everything about this hotel. The reception staff were really polite and very helpful when needed. The hotel has a great roof-top terrace which is great for afternoon drinks in the sun or pre-dinner drinks under the stars! Breakfast is simple, cold meats, cheeses, cereals etc with the option to have hot cooked food such as omlettes all of which were very nice, if you drink coffee have one at breakfast its so good it tastes almost like chocolate! Our room was very nice (room 203) with a big bed and a lovely marble-look bathroom. Whenever we needed room service or phoned hotel reception they immediately sent someone up and they were knocking on the door within 30 seconds - no joke! When we come back to Venice we will certainly stay here as its in one of the best locations, close to Rialto bridge and a short walk to St Marks square. If you want to stay somewhere really nice but don't want to fork out the silly prices of the 5star establishments then stay here you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Convienent and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: canaia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 5 week vacation to Italy. We stayed in 6 different 4/5 star hotels. Hotel a La Commedia was our favourite. The minute we arrived the staff at the front desk made us feel welcome and at ease. Massimo was extremely helpful every morning when we needed tips on how to get somewhere or where to dine. The rooms were beautiful, clean and spacious. It is in the perfect location, a 5 minute walk to San Marco and 3 minutes to the Rialto Bridge. Although the hotel is located on a busy street the windows blocked out all the noise and we had no trouble sleeping. They also have a gorgeous rooftop terrace. Lucio the bar tender makes the best bellinis in Venice. Harry's Bar is not worth the money and they aren't even made with real peaches! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb! Bad reviews are to be ignored!”
Reviews.Author: ytb_com_cliffedge
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a trip to Milan and Venice with my wife for vacation and both hotels Enterprise in Milan and A La Commedia in Venice were perfection! Boasting a fabulous location in between San Marco and Rialto, A La Commedia is an indisputable 4 star facility with everything you could want. Top of the line service, staff, cleaning service, rooms, decent breakfast and a nice terrace bar overlooking Venice. Bathrooms were large, very modernly updated and clean. Bed was beautiful and cozy. There's a huge safe, the air conditioning worked perfectly and the mini-bar/fridge is nicely stocked and roomy. Free water taxi ride to Murano factory/museum but no pressure was put on us like some have said. Yes you are on your own to come back but the waterbus is reasonably priced and is a pleasant ride back. Windows were openable and drowned out all noise (not that there was any) and we slept like babies. I had an idea of where we wanted to do dinners but we asked the desk for recommendations anyway, they were friendly (especially Roberto who's there in the afternoons), helpful and politely spoke perfect English without being annoyed about having to. They sent us to Bistrot de Venise (on the way to San Marco) which is 11 on tripadvisor and was superb. They recommended Trattoria Scala (for cheaper and casual) and Paradiso as well. We did Pardiso (not Paradiso Perduto) which is a block in from the Grand Canal on the opposite side of where the hotel is just over Rialto Bridge (make a left off the bridge and then go down a few blocks and make a right) and was very pleased. The owner serves you himself and was very nice to us. We were warned by the desk to stay away from the Grand Canal restaurants and that was such good advice as we did try one place over there just for the experience. The food was very good and arrived in record time but the service was a bit rude and uncouth. Listen to the desk's advice about dining. It may cost you more but you get more bang for the buck if you listened to their advice. Even though no one was around the terrace bar when we went up there they happily opened my own bottle of wine for us and we were able to enjoy it without being pressed into buying their drinks only. There was one couple up there with us but they were so at peace with their surroundings that together in a comfortable large lounge chair they were napping early in the evening. There's internet service at a fee but most of Venice is like that. Just don't purchase the time if you don't want to pay, there are plenty of wi-fi for free places in Venice if you absolutely must use internet. Venice sells itself but this hotel puts your stay over the top and makes it memorable. We are so going to go back to Venice ( to visit some things we did not get to see like Lido beach, Burano, Paveglia and a few other attractions) and we will most definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “As Close to Perfect as it Gets!”
Reviews.Author: Calmtravelers
Reviews.Content: Venice was the last stop of our trip, and Hotel A La Commedia was the perfect choice for our group of ten people (spanning three generations)! We stayed at wonderful, beautiful boutique hotels in Rome and Florence, and for most of us this was that much better! The hotel was able to give us five rooms on the same floor, in the same area, which was great (so tweens and teens could be near parents, with grandparents having a spacious, elegant junior suite). When we drew back the curtains in our deluxe room, we were pleasantly surprised by a lovely view. Our rooms were all gorgeously decorated, with relaxing hues, comfortable beds (with small canopies) and nice lighting. The hotel's location, close to the Rialto Bridge, but set back, was just right and quiet. Breakfast was in a lovely little dining room, that opened up to be just a bit bigger when it got more crowded. The food was very good (try the lemon tart) and the cappucino terrific! And the very tall gentleman who helped serve breakfast (whose name we don't remember, sorry) was as nice as can be!! This hotel has an unbelievable rooftop bar which serves drinks (that surprisingly were pretty reasonably priced) and non-alcoholic freshly-made juice drinks. There are tables and extra-wide lounges that are so comfortable and romantic. We spent a long time talking to Lucia, the bartender, one late afternoon. He was very nice and very interesting, and told us to feel comfortable just hanging out up there any time during the evening or night even if we didn't order anything. The front desk staff were generally fabulous -- especially Frederico and Roberto, who were extremely knowledgeable and helpful. The only constructive comment I'd make is that they seemed to steer us to restaurants that were more expensive (although nothing in Venice is inexpensive) than necessary, considering that we were a group of ten. We had the impression that the hotel had "relationships" with certain restaurants that may have impacted the objectivity of certain recommendations. That said, we found some wonderful and reasonably-priced restaurants that we highly recommend. Check out Barababao and Rosa Rossa, which were both fun, with great food, and realistically-priced. We would absolutely stay at A La Commedia again and hope to see the lovely people that helped us during our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: TheThree16
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 3 week trip to Europe, which ended with two days at Hotel a La Commedia. We booked this hotel last November, and had to pre-pay. This type of payment for hotels was new to us; however, completely worth the risk. The room we had, which was on the second floor, was terrific and spacious. The entire hotel reflected the clean guest rooms, which is always important to us. The location of the hotel was also perfect. Although it was not on any canal, it was certainly a two minute walk to the Grand Canal, and 5 minutes to the Rialto bridge. It was around a 10 minute walk (with a young child) to St. Mark's Square - all in all, for us, it was a great location. The staff were extremely helpful, and told us about the various things that were going on in Venice the two days that we were there. It is certainly easy to get to by water bus (Rialto stop); however, we took a water taxi from the cruise port and then after to the airport. The taxi costs were ridiculous, but this was certainly no fault of the hotel - this is just Venice transportation (Bus is much more reasonalbe but you have to contend with A LOT of stops). They informed us in advance how much it would be, and they ensured that a water taxi was waiting for us so that we could make our flight in time. The porter helped us to get to the taxi, as we had a lot of luggage! All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel, and if you don't mind pre-booking, this is GREAT value for your money!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: Bud-n-Lin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at another hotel in Piazzale Roma for one night before a cruise because of its proximity to the cruise terminal. It was on the canal and rated 3 stars. It was advertised to have a room controlled a/c but the a/c was non-existent. It was cooler to have the window open! Once on the cruise we asked fellow cruisers if they had a hotel they liked in Venice and they recommended Hotel a La Commedia. We read some reviews on tripadvisor using the ship's internet at sea and decided to just go for it (it was only 25 dollars more for a 4 star hotel). We disembarked the boat and took a free shuttle back to Piazzale Roma. We thought about taking the vaporetto but decided to walk (we only had two light bags). It took about 20 minutes with stops to take photos and get drinks. It wasn't a bad walk since it was early in the morning, cool and not crowded at all. We crossed the Rialto bridge and 4 minutes later, we arrived at the hotel. The room wasn't ready since we were so early and the concierge told us that they were awaiting some checkouts. We registered and left our bags and went to explore the area. St. Mark's square (San Marco) was very close. We walked along the canal and found some neat places to eat lunch. We love the location of the hotel! We walked back to the hotel at 3pm (check in is 2pm) and we were given our key. The room is spacious (double bed) with excellent air conditioning which you can control. Lighting was excellent and could be turned off and on right next to the bed (very convenient). Bathroom was spacious with a soaking tub, rainshower head, and hand held shower. The wardrobe was spacious and very modern. We only stayed for one night but could have stayed for 10 more! Free buffet breakfast was adequate (cereal, croissants, deli meats, bread, jams, coffee, teas, juice, and water--- you can pay for mor ecooked foods like eggs). We took the vaporetto at the Rialto Bridge to Piazzale Roma for 6.50 Euros each and then paid 3 Euros (get tickets at the bus terminal not at actv) to take a direct bus (D2 bus waiting area) to the airport. It took us about an hour from hotel to airport (but we didn't have to really wait for water bus or express bus). But we definitely recommend this hotel!! Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION. LOVELY HOTEL ....”
Reviews.Author: littlebooMidlands
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel a la commedia for 4 nights ...our room was immaculate ,friendly welcome at reception and an excellent Bellini on the roof terrace made in the traditional Venician way with fresh peach juice! The location of the hotel is 30 yards from the Grand Canal and Rialto bridge ...allowing us to explore Venice on foot ...... Venice is not cheap in any way ....be aware ,our budget of Â£100 euro a day didnt go far ... on meals....but we would recommend the simple "trattoria a al madonna" restaurant, delicious food , good prices and great atmosphere ...a real find!

Reviews.Title: “Venice with style, great value, superb service and awesome location”
Reviews.Author: sober_man
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights. Staff was always helpful and corteous. Hotel looks highly renovated, everything in great condition. The terrace is excellent to have a drink before go to sleep. The hotel is really close to the Rialto bridge, so close to the 'vaporetto' stop and airport orange line pick up and drop off location. It's located between San Marcos Piazza and Rialto Bridge, it's also close to a couple of theathers and the Opera. A lot of shopping, from local souveniers to famous brands boutiques. Restaurants for every budget around the hotel. We had a triple room, where you can accomodate up to 4 adults with no problems. It doesn't have Canal view rooms, but ammenities are the same or even better than other nice hotels with Canal views and prices a couple of hundred euros more. (I've stayed in a couple of those before). In summary it's a great place to enjoy your visit to one of the most beautiful and unique cities of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for first visit to Venice”
Reviews.Author: CiaoBellaCheshire
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay in Venice through Citalia to stay at the Monaco Grand Canal.However having read some of the reviews about the hotel on trip advisor I was a bit wary of staying there.So I did some further research and found that the A La Commedia was recieving very complimentary reviewsa and switched our booking.We were so pleased that we did.The Hotel A La Commedia was perfect.Really friendly and helpful staff.The bedrooms were tastefully appointed,clean and comfortable.Good air con,luxury bathroom.We couldn`t fault the hotel at all.Good location,just a few minutes from the Rialto Bridge and a short walk to St Mark`s square.The roof terrace was perfect for an evening cocktail,watching the England game! The bar man certainly knew his football.Thank you to all the staff for making our stay in Venice so pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location! Very helpful staff!!”
Reviews.Author: rachieou
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in a great location in Venice!!! It is very close to the Rialto Bridge as well as the beautiful San Marco Square! The staff is very very helpful and friendly! The Bar in the lobby is great and the rooms are clean and very well sized! Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've stayed in in Italian - absolutely superb”
Reviews.Author: Holidayseeker2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is thoroughly superb. We stayed for 6 nights and the hotel made it for us because of the luxury and convenience it offers. The location is superb, just 200 metres from Rialto and not much further to Saint Marcs. The hotel looks like it's just been refurbished and the rooms are palacial, which is unique for an Italian hotel in this price bracket. There is no view from the room we were in, but it didn't matter at all. The location of the hotel means you can pop back to the hotel at any time without a need to detour, which means if the weather changes you can get back to the hotel without a worry. The rooms are quiet and exceptionally well decorated with Silk on the walls with Merano glass light fittings and big marble bathroom. The breakfast is good - we only had continental each morning, cooked breakfast is offered at a supplement. Staff on reception are very friendly and helpful. Overall a superb hotel and I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “We spent the first 4 nights of our...”
Reviews.Author: Brownies40
Reviews.Content: We spent the first 4 nights of our honeymoon in Venice in this hotel, and what a hotel. The rooms are amazing, the breakfast was superb, and the location is perfect. The staff were so helpful, they booked us into some amazing restuarants, booked our romantic gondola ride and nothing was to much trouble for them. Don't go to Harry's Bar for a Bellini, ask Lucia at the bar at the hotel to make one for you it is amazing and not out of a bottle which it is at so many places in Venice. We will be back to celebrate our wedding anniversaries xxx

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at Hotel a la Commedia”
Reviews.Author: BeachNut
Reviews.Content: If youâ€™re looking for a newer hotel with old world charm and elegance, this is the place to stay. My husband and I just returned from an awesome stay at the Hotel a la Commedia and weâ€™d highly recommend it to anyone planning a trip to Venice. Here are the details of our stay: ROOM: The rooms are exactly as pictured on their website. We booked a Junior Suite which could easily accommodate 5 people. It was a spacious, elegant, tastefully decorated room with a King size bed and walkout from bedroom to balcony, a reading light on both sides of the bed, 2 large mirrored closets, sitting area with pull-out couch, 2 flat screen tvâ€™s, mini-bar and in-room safe. The room also had a huge bathroom fully equipped with double sinks, hair dryer, magnifying mirror, toilet, bidet, deep soaking tub with rainshower showerhead and also hand held shower, clothes line, heated towel rack, stool, bathrobes and slippers. We had no problem with the water pressure or getting hot water. Entry to the room was by electronic key with a huge gold tassel on the end, not a magnetic card! Something we have never seen before. HOTEL: The lobby contained a small entrance area with a two person check in desk on one side and a bar with seating area on the other side. Hotel staff were friendly and efficient. The small elevator up to the rooms was awesome with dark smoked glass mirrors and a roof that mimicked a starry night sky. Something weâ€™ve not seen anywhere else. The hotel also had a rooftop bar where you could go to relax and have a drink. Unfortunately, it was closed during our stay due to bad weather. Our room rate included a buffet breakfast, which included cereals, cold meats, pastries, fresh juices, cookies and fresh cut fruit. Eggs could be ordered for an additional 3.50 Euro - a far cry from the 50 Euro charged for breakfast by other hotels. Breakfast was served in their elegant breakfast room. The Front Desk also arranges one way trips to Murano as well as gondola rides. We took the trip to Murano and it was well worth the trip. The hotel arranged a private water taxi ride to the island where we watched a demonstration on how they create their glass masterpieces. From there we were taken to the factoryâ€™s showroom where all their pieces were displayed. No high pressure sales pitch ensued. Their unique masterpieces on the second floor were out of this world and so were the prices. But one thing for sure, the quality was far superior to that of the other factories on the island. We also took the gondola ride arranged by the front desk. That in our opinion was a bit of a rip-off. We were charged 30 Euro each for a 40 minute ride and shared the ride with four other hotel guests. The ride itself was great, with the gondolier pointing out various points of interest and providing historical details. We later went back to the same gondola stand to inquire about rates which we found out was actually 80 Euro for the boat for a 30 minute ride. Advice â€“ if itâ€™s just the two of you traveling, spend the extra 20 Euro and get a nice romantic gondola ride for just the two of you. LOCATION AND DIRECTIONS: Hotel a la Commedia is conveniently located close to Rialto Bridge and all other tourist attractions as well as within 10 minutes of Piazza San Marco. It can be reached either by ACTV line 1 or 2, but line 1 is your better option. When we first arrived in Venice, we took line 2 which seemed to be an express waterbus to Rialto. However, when we got off at the Rialto stop, it was further away from the hotel. Although it was no more than a 5 minute walk, we had to drag our luggage over a small bridge with steps on both sides. We later took line 1 and found that the Rialto stop for that line was closer to the hotel (only 2 minutes) with no bridges to cross. Just be careful NOT TO GET OFF AT THE RIALTO MERCADO stop. That stop is on the opposite side of the Grand Canal and you would have to drag your luggage across the Rialto Bridge or get back on the ACTV to get off at the next Rialto stop. All in all we had a thoroughly enjoyable stay at the Hotel a la Commedia and would return again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel simply superb”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Mrs_G_Thompson
Reviews.Content: Booked a few days in the romantic city of Venice, as a wedding anniversary celebration. The hotel was simply superb. Excellent location, close to the Rialto Bridge and Grand Canal, so the sights are but a 2 minute stroll away. A further 5-10 minute stroll through the winding maze of canals and quaint bridges brings you to St Marks Square. Surrounded by restaurants and high quality fashion stares. The rooms were spotless withan immaculate bathroom and comfortable bed. They were very luxurious and large, by Italian strandards. The staff were extremely friendly, the reception desk were polite and provided a wealth of local information. The hotel provided a free visit to the Muarano glass centre. The breakfast provided plenty of choice and provided a good start to the day. If you are looking for a superb hotel, with a fantastic location,then look no further. The Hotel a La Commedia is a true gem in Venice. Would we stay again, of definite YES!

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of luxury for a very reasonable price...”
Reviews.Author: Shaw11946
Reviews.Content: Was very pleasantly surprised by Hotel a La Commedia! It seems to be a newer hotel...we had a standard room, and the presentation was really over the top. Lots of brass, heavy drapes, marble (or faux marble--not sure), lovely decor. The room was very big, we thought, and the bathroom was luxurious. The breakfast was really terrific--a nice buffet with plenty of options, great coffee, the option for hot foods. The rooftop lounge was a very nice feature, a good place to get away from the crowds (which weren't terrible this time of year) and just relax in the beautiful spring weather. The hotel is easy walking distance from the Rialto Bridge and the Vaparetto stop there, and it's not far at all from Piazza San Marco--just far enough away, if you ask us. The staff was courteous, friendly, spoke perfect English, and offered plenty of advice and information. I don't give many five-star across-the-board reviews to anything, but this one truly is a find. When we return to Venice, we definitely will stay here again. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: kinsy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in this luxurious hotel on Trip Advisor recommendation. Doubt you could find a more convenient location at the price being so close to Rialto Bridge and about 10 minutes walk to St. Marks. Extremely comfortable and enjoyable stay and have already booked to return.

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: SanantoneUk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Venice. This is a stunning hotel, perfectly situated for all sites and travel. Cleanliness was first class with twice a day room service. Staff very helpful and friendly. Would definately stay again

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Bill M
Reviews.Content: Getting to the hotel from Marco Polo airport, was on this occasion 'an adventure'. Arriving late afternoon we caught a water bus which as according to directions on the website deposited us at the St Marks stop. The easy walk to the hotel took longer than expected but we got there. In a future visit I would go via bus from the airport and then water bus to the Rialto stop which is literally two minutes walk. The hotel itself is all that you could expect in a city centre, comfortable, and well maintained rooms, although the staff insisted on resetting the thermostat up after I had turned it down. The continental breakfasts were certainly ample, and the lack of bacon and eggs was no problem to us. The staff at all times were pleasant and helpul for local matters, but were not aware of the volcano eruption on the day we were leaving. This did not detract from our enjoyment in our stay at the Commedia, and I would recommend it to future visitors as an ideal location for visiting Venice. Bilma

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect !!!”
Reviews.Author: allalouff
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel, perfect location - just a few metres wakl from the Rialto water bus station and a few minutes walk from st Mark's square! Amazing room, very clean, big bathroom also very clean.The room was exactly as advertised at the hotel's web page. Breakfast is ok, but you have to pay extra if you want eggs, bacon or sausage. The staff was very helpful with many good suggestions of how to organize our visit, booking museums, gondola tour and restaurants. The Murano island visit tour was complimentary from the hotel also. We will definitely stay here again next time we visit Venice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fit for a king!”
Reviews.Author: kambahkid
Reviews.Content: Not a single thing out of place in this hotel, definately a must when visiting Venice. The rooms were immaculate and breakfast absolutely amazing! Lucio behind the bar is excellent and can provide you with the suitable drink for any mood or time of day. Staff all round are friendly and welcoming, while still providing a professional and knowledgeable service. Very happy, great location between the Ponte Rialto and San Marco Square which was even easy to find at 10pm at night in the floating labrynth that is Venice.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sd44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in the beginning of March and loved this hotel. We had a little bit of difficulty finding it at first from the water bus but after that it was great. It is actually very close to the rialto exit once you know where you are going. The staff is very helpful and nice. We arrived early from a night train and our room wans't ready so they checked our luggage and gave us a map and directions to the main areas and restaurants. Once we did get to our room it was very nice with a comfortable king size bed, good sized bathroom, safe, minibar etc. The breakfast which is included had a good assortment of typical european breakfast items meats, cheese, breads, yogurts, fresh fruit and also a dessert cake that was very tastey. The location is centrally located but the closest major site was the rialto bridge. We would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Conviently located lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: David7London
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend in March. This is a lovely hotel conviently located for all of the sites in Venice. The hotel room we had suited our needs and the bed was really comfortable ensuring a good nights sleep. The hotel decor is very nice and we found all the staff extremelly pleasant and helpful. The hotel is located about 10 minutes walk from Piazza San Marco and the Rialto Bridge is a couple of minutes walk away. To get to the hotel from the airport catch the water bus (Orange Line) to the Rialto Bridge and get off there, hotel is about 3 minutes walk from there. Would recommend this hotel and would go back and stay there if going to Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the extra money”
Reviews.Author: SDTravelot_03
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, but not worth the extra money. Definitely lush, but I think the "four class" status makes them think they can charge outrageous amounts for really trivial services. For example, I stayed at a budget class hotel in Florence and got free wifi, but I splurged by staying at the Commedia and they wanted to charge something like 8 euro for an hour of internet usage. Was a very nice hotel, no doubt about it, but if you're going to Venice on a budget, probably not worth the splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Radu1977
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Venice and I must say that I had a great stay at the "A La Commedia" hotel. We booked a Deluxe Double and it was great. Roomy enough, nice bathroom, perfect clean (twice a day cleaning). The receptionists all very nice and helpful. Breakfast it's not outstanding but is good. You have to pay some extra if you want to have fried eggs and that was not very cheap. But you can live without it. The location was just great. Few minutes walk to San Marco and just a minute walk from Rialto bridge. Nice restaurants nearby. Next time I will return to the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: mrsjacks0n
Reviews.Content: My travelling companion and I stayed at this gem for one week at the end of January. The hotel is beautiful and the welcome was second to none. Our room was immaculate, and was kept that way despite our best efforts... Bathroom was huge and we had a wonderful bath, ideal for a long soak at the end of the day. All the staff were polite and informative and a special mention must go to Emanuel (hope that is correct) the head breakfast waiter whose welcome every morning was gratefully received by someone who isn't at her best in the morning... Venice itself was everything we had expected and more. I would have no hesitation staying here again or recommending it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but expensive!”
Reviews.Author: fergalfrog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights as part of our Italian honeymoon. We paid Eur 990 in total which I have to say was a bit more than we would normally spend. I should point out that this was our first time in Venice and so perhaps all hotels are expensive in the city centre. The staff were all friendly and the location couldn't be any better. Yoy are a 1 minute was from the Rialto bridge and right in the middle of everything. We booked a Junior Suite - however I had to contact the hotel when I got home to verify this as the room was much smaller than a suite would suggest. A couple of things I found lacking with our stay - There are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. - our tv had only one or two English channels - wireless internet is expensive at 19 euro for 24 hours - breakfast was a limited buffet which was not the best and eggs cost extra. All up unless you really want to stay in the middle of the city I think you can get much better value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything!”
Reviews.Author: LovelyAngus
Reviews.Content: For first-time visitors to Venezia, Hotel a La Commedia is situated in an easy-to-find location. We arrived at Marco Polo Airport at 19:55 on Saturday, August 2009. Taking Alilaguna (Linea Arancio) at 20:40 from the airport, we got off at Rialto at 21:34. From the waterbus stop, it's just a few minute walk to this hotel. The receptionist and the porter affably welcomed us who were very exhausted due to the unfamiliar boat ride. As we requested in advance, they prepared two separated beds in the modestly-sized room. We stayed 5 nights and had no complaints about their housekeeping service. There are a few things that it would be nice to: have an electric pot in the room so that we could drink hot water anytime we want to, and have bread a bit warmed at breakfast. Otherwise, this hotel is perfect for someone who goes around all the Venezia attractions!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for my wife's 30th”
Reviews.Author: X-Cile
Reviews.Content: This is the second time me and wife have been to Venice and more importantly was a treat for her 30th birthday. We chose A La Commedia because of all the great reviews not just on tripadvisor but on expedia and other review sites. Plus the pictures of the hotel and rooms looked impressive. I don't know if it was just our badluck that we've been given a room where it did not live up to expectations. Compared to the first hotel (palace bonvecchiati) we stayed in on our first trip to Venice this was no where near that. We chose 2 nights in the classic standard double, though not all is bad and I do want to give a fair assessment so onto the good stuff first - Staff Very friendly and on hand to make us feel welcomed. They mustve checked our records when they took photocopies of our passports because on my wifes birthday, one of the staff popped up to our room and gave us a complimentary bag of cookies. Now that is being thoughtful. Location and Value In an excellent location just round the corner from the Rialto Bridge and only 10mins walk to San Marco square so this would be dead center in the tourism attraction areas. It is probably one of the cheapest 4* hotels you will be able to find in that area. Design & Decor It is nice clean hotel and the decor is very "Venice". It has a gold theme throughout which makes it feel quite luxurious and prestigious. Ok so my review looks all good so far, but most importantly is the experience with the your room and unfortunately, this is where its starts going wrong - No bath tub! I dont know how many rooms in the hotel actually has a bath tub en-suite but we was unlucky enough to be given one with a shower ensuite. Thats a no no for me as there would be nothing better than to relax in a bath full of water after a long day's walk in Venice. Maybe because of the no bathtub thing, I then started to get a little critical about the room. - The room size was actually very small - No kettle in room hence and no complimentary coffee/tea sachets, for a 4* hotel this should be easy - TV Channels was just local, probably 1 or 2 english channels but there was no menu for hotel premium channels such as movies or internet - Hotel Info folder that you normally get with the usual hotel services or local info. This had nothing in it but the do not disturbed/make room tags. Why call it an info folder when there is no info in it? - Ok normally in the bathroom you get real glass cup for toohbrushing right? We got a couple of clear plastic cups! I know these are small things I'm moaning about but for a 4* hotel, these small things should be super easy. For me, this hotel was more a 3* and does not deserve to be hyped about. Once in this hotel is enough for me, I definitely would not revisit. Palace bonvecchiati was heaps better and the next time we go to Venice again I will most probably stay there.

Reviews.Title: “My wife's 50 birthday”
Reviews.Author: alp1961
Reviews.Content: excelent hotel, but ... poor breakfat , no bacon & eggs , only paying 3 eur

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Spyder80
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before, but felt that Hotel La Commedia was so outstanding compared to other hotels in the same price range that it deserved a nod. The hotel is located in a perfect spot for the majority of major attractions in Venice, but is far enough from the tourist laden canals to be a peaceful place. The hotel is clean, the rooms are large and modern, the furnishings are rich and luxurious and the bathrooms are to die for. The breakfast room, roof top bar and other amenities are equally lovely. Breakfast at the hotel is buffet style with various cheeses, cold meats, cereals, beatiful fresh bread, pate, croissants and other pastries, jams, honey, juice, tea and coffee. Those who like a hot breakfast can ask for one to be prepared for a fee. The front desk staff were always polite and helpful. They even organised a gondola tour for 25 euros per person, although this meant having to share the gondola with other hotel guests. Venice is a beatiful place but can be very hectic and expensive, so finding a hotel which you can happily return to at the end of a tiring day is priceless. If the hotel could improve on something, it would be to open up the breakfast room for evening dining. Despite this very minor issue, I would happily return again!

Reviews.Title: “perfect spot for 3 days in venice”
Reviews.Author: goodcookie
Reviews.Content: what a gem! lovely hotel, just a block or so from the vaporetto #1 stop and a very short walk to St. Marks Square. Rialto was the next vaporetto stop and a very easy walk. The rooms were large, with wooden floors. The linens were changed every day, including the duvet covers. The bathroom was large and immaculate. Breakfast was fine--juice, several cereals, yogurt, fresh fruit, hot eggs, bacon and sausages, pastries. You can't go hungry at that buffet and cappuccino was no problem. This is a place I would return to, without question, next time in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: KateIA
Reviews.Content: We found this Hotel on GTA Hotels site back in June and received a very good price for a Double Room. We were very Happy with the Hotel. The location was perfect for Venice and all the Sites. The Staff were very nice (esp the Bartender) We spent alot of time with the bartender and learned alot about Venice from him. Rooms were very clean and well equiped. I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: WiltshireBeth
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and after checking the reviews on several hotels we picked La Commedia, what a find! It is in a great location very close to the Rialto Bridge and vaporetto stop on the Grand Canal. It was so easy to reach everything we wanted to see. The hotel staff were very helpful - I asked for a softer pillow as the bedding is quite firm, and this was taken care of immediately. The reception staff especially have great language skills (we listened in as two of them moved with ease into german, french and english) We had an upgrade on our room (booking with Citalia) which was extremely comfortable, with a large 6ft bed. One thing which stood out was how the room and all the communal areas we saw were immaculate. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MPD95
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location and the room was wonderful - lots of room, great amenities, nice view. It was so easy to get to from the Rialto stop when we first arrived and it was the perfect place to get our bearings...quick to get to st. marks and rialto. The hotel staff were very helpful and accommodating. When we first checked in our room - while a non-smoking facility - it smelled of smoke and they quickly changed our room. The breakfast was nothing remarkable but it was great to have someplace to go to...coffee/tea, fresh fruit, cereals, croissants/breads, jams, cheeses and hams/meats. Hotel staff offered to get us a gondola ride, but it was much cheaper to just get one on our own. The use of their internet/computer was reasonable and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: CherylGL
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd trip to Venice; my friends' first. La Commedia was ideal -- great location near the Rialto and San Marco, yet away from crowds. The service, especially at the front desk was wonderful. They are knowledgeable, friendly, and have a sense of humor. Since there were 3 of us, we booked a suite. Plenty of room, especially for Venice! Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Service - Great Room”
Reviews.Author: foreigner16
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the right place - not too close / not too far from Piazza San Marco - 2-minute walk from the Rialto Bridge, 5-minute walk to Piazza San Marco and 10-minute walk to La Academia. Check-in: We arrived at 1:00 am because of a flight delay and the front desk man received us with a smile and "dispatch" us to the room in less than 1 minute (just the passport to check identity). Front desk people, waiter at breakfast and everybody at the hotel were allways in good mood and extremely polite during the whole stay. Rooms are tidy, clean adn you note that the hotel has been constructed / refurbushed a few years ago. I would come back to Alla Commedia withour hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped for!”
Reviews.Author: spsandi
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great! Room was a little small, had to rearrange to be able to take suitcase of the bed, but we had a large balcony and bathroom was huge. Very convenient to the Rialto vaporetto stop and San Marco square. The airport vaporetto also stops at Rialto which is great if traveling by air. I would highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Grange80
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent with a great location and fantastic rooms - the roof top bar was a lovely treat and the cocktails were fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service, Wonderful location and elegant hotel with great rooftop terrace bar”
Reviews.Author: daspbh
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Austria and Venice and we loved this small chic hotel with 5 star service and nice ammenities. Really nice breakfast buffet and wonderful rooftop terrace bar area where we met our favorite bartender Emmanuelle who took care of us like we were his old friends and gave us impeccable 1st class service as well as great conversation. My favorite part of my Venice trip by far. We will be back again. Delia and Patrick.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: schnikelfritzFlorida
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great central location and very easy to find. From the train station it was a quick ride on the #2 vaporetto to the Rialto stop. From there it was an easy walk to the hotel. It was nice because you could always find your way back. All you had to do was follow the Rialto signs. We were upgraded to a suite and the room was very spacious and elegant. There was a nice breakfast buffet included with the room and the front desk staff was very helpful. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute must”
Reviews.Author: askjan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to Venice every year for our wedding anniversary and usually stay in another hotel of the same group (which I would also highly recommend). One of the staff members from out usual hotel Andrea, has moved to La Commedia and invited us to call in to have a look around. The hotel is chic, stylish and very sophisticated while being easily accessable (especially with suit cases), close to all the things and places you would want to see in Venice but not in the thick of the noise. there is a fantastic roof terrace where you can enjoy a drink in the evening, beautiful rooms -some with a balcony and inlaid gold in the bathroom floor tiles. Check it out and tell Andrea Janet & Roger Askey sent you!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BDGALL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in July and from the moment we arrived we knew we had made the right decision. The reception area is small but lovely and the reception staff are very helpful and friendly. We were shown to our room and had our luggage delivered within a few minutes of arriving and then a complementary chilled bottle of Prosecco arrived to help us celebrate our wedding anniversary - the perfect start to our holiday! The room was spacious and included a massive bed, 3-seater couch, small table and chairs. The rooms are very well soundproofed - even though their was construction work going on outside, we hardly heard a thing. The wardrobe and drawer space was adequate for a 4 night stay but you might struggle if you are staying for longer. The bathroom was huge and beautifully decorated with double sinks, a great shower and came with lovely fluffy towels and good quality toiletries. The rooftop terrace is a great suntrap and a fantastic place to have a relaxing drink. Breakfast is very good, although their isn't a huge choice, it is more than adequate and the coffee is fantastic. We took the hotels free boat to Murano including a tour of a glass factory and really enjoyed it - yes you do need to walk around the glass showroom where salesmen are trying to get you to buy, but after 10/15 mins of browsing you can leave and discover the rest of the island yourself. Before going to Murano one of the hotel receptionists made sure that we knew exactly what vaporetto to get back to San Marco and drew this on a city map for us. This really is a wonderful, centrally located hotel with very friendly staff, outstanding quality of accommodation and we would never consider staying anywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A Winner!”
Reviews.Author: PPDavis
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 city tour of Rome, Florence, and Venice. This hotel was by far the best. I would definitely return to this lovely find. I was thrilled to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!..”
Reviews.Author: Karen_Bardos
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Hotel a La Commedia. The hotel is in a great location.. close to st marco square. The room was lovely with a large, well equipped bath. The staff were very helpful. Breakfast was light, not the highlight but we would definitey return!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Trin12
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with friends who had booked and arranged the trip to Venice. It is a fantastic hotel in a great location. Very central so all the main sights of Venice are very close by. The Rialto bridge is 2 mins walk away and St. Mark's square about 5 mins away (providing you don't get lost!). The hotel was extremely clean and the rooms were lovely. The air conditioning is a must in Venice in summer, not only does it cool you down after a long day it enables you to keep the windows shut at night and the mosquitos out! The staff are fantastic. The front desk staff are lovely, extremely welcoming and nothing is too much trouble. The head waiter Emmanuel is brilliant. He seems to be wherever you need him just at the right time, very courteous and efficient - obviously takes pride in his job. I would highly recommend this hotel if you're staying in Venice

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: dwhir
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor and have been extremely satisfied. The location couldn't be better, it is equidistant from Rialto and St. Marks so it gets an A+ for convenience. We got here from the train station via an easy #2 Vaproretto ride to the Rialto stop (a three minute walk from there). The hotel is very clean and comfortable with nice rooms.. It also has a beautiful rooftop terrace for winding down the day. The staff has been very friendly and helpful (although not all of them are as well trained as others). All in all, a definite recommendation. You won't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “feel for the staff !!!!”
Reviews.Author: davepug
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel !!!!! But i am in the service trade, the staff working there are a credit to the firm. but they are under staffed by a few. Lucio the barman very good and a great source of knowledge. Marco covered the suitcases one day the bar the next, also very good. Roberto on the desk always very helpful and polite. But the best was Emanuele the Headwaiter who seemed to cover most aspects of the hotel's day to day jobs, sorting breakfast, room service, barman, superb !!!! All the staff were most friendly and as i said a credit to the firm, look after them Hotel a La Commedia or somebody else in Venice will ! moving on, great location, spotless through out, beautiful roof terrace.

Reviews.Title: “This small hotel is a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: organisedchaos7
Reviews.Content: La Commedia hotel is near the Rialto Bridge in a side road and so easy to find your way back to. The rooms are decorated luxuriously. Tiny bar area. Small breakfast room but doesn't double up as a restaurant in the evening, which is a shame. Go on their website to see for yourself how nice it is.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location, Great service.”
Reviews.Author: Karlinoz31
Reviews.Content: Great stay, Hotel is located very well easy walk to all the attractions, The service was fanastic which made our stay very easy. The rooms where quite small but lovely furnishings. Very clean hotel with a lovely breakfast service.

Reviews.Title: “â€œSuperb hotel, great service, perfect locationâ€�”
Reviews.Author: islacanela
Reviews.Content: Hotel Commedia is situated in a â€œlittle oasisâ€� near the Rialto Bridge and just a ten minute stroll from St Marks square. It is an ideal hotel from which to explore Venice. Everything about the hotel is just right, luxury in a friendly atmosphere. The reception staff were extremely helpful and eager to share their knowledge of Venice. Guests were always greeted with a smile and a cheerful â€œbuon giornoâ€œ The hotel is small and intimate, drinks, sandwiches and salads are served either in the small bar off reception or on the roof terrace. Continental breakfast is served in on the first floor dinning room. A full breakfast menu is also provided at a reasonable price. Our Deluxe room (404) on the 4th. floor was quite and comfortable with flat screen TV, etc. Hotel Commedia certainly added to our enjoyment of Venice and I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys quietness and luxury in a busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great service, perfect location, European beds”
Reviews.Author: Dmitry1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I staid at this hotel for 7 nights. The front staff was very helpful and curtious. In the morning they had very high quality breakfast with delicious coffee. The breakfast area is set up like a restaurant (silverware, tablecloth, linen napkins, etc.) which is a very nice touch. The food was very fresh, and the only negative was that every day it was the same thing, which I don't mind as long as it is of high quality and the viriety of chocies was good. The servers at breakfast (they serve you coffee or items off an additional cost menu which was expansive and reasonably priced), were very professional. Rooms were excellent - large, expansive marble bathroom, flatscreen tv, etc. The bed is a European bed (two twins put togehter t create a king size with a king size blankets and linens.) The mattress was hard and pillows low and hard. This is a typical Europen setup, so I cannot fault the hotel. One recommendation is for the hotel to designate a few rooms and have softer pillows and matresses there for American travleers and just charge more for those rooms ( a good night sleep is priceless.) Location was perfect (extrememly close to the Realto bridge as well as St Marco Square). The fact that there are no canal views is not a problem, a you see them all day long and being set back allows the hotel to be a bit quiter. I was concerned about some reviewers mention of a night club and noise up till 3am, but we did notexperience it. The room was generally very quite, and any noise that you might hear is really very muted city noise which is absolutely normal. So I would not be concerned about that. Definitly take them on the offer of a free tour to Murano (you get to go on a nice and fast boat) and have great picture opportunities galore from teh boat. Remember, you have to find your own way back (water taxi or the water bus) - the water bus runs hourly and they are surprisingly extremely precise.
