We have ate at a lot of restaurants, but the one that was memorable was called Zucca (highly recommend to check it out - fantastic food, good atmosphere, creative choices with a lot for vegeterians, but you have to make reservations.) Hope you will find my review helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Super location, staff and hotel-a delight all around”
Reviews.Author: Maggie_Oakshot
Reviews.Content: Everything here was either very good or great--except the pillows. Somehow my gringa American head has not gotten accustomed to the hard sausage shaped European pillows. The front desk staff excellent--all three we dealt with. Very knowledgeable, engaging and willing to help. The room lovely, a respite in a city that is never empty of tourists. Which made it a getaway for our alone time--too. IF you can go a bit off season, you also save $$. The breakfast very good--the coffee EXcellent (and I'm usually a tea drinker because so much coffee is swill.)

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and friendly”
Reviews.Author: pahy
Reviews.Content: We're just back from venice and i just had to comment on the hotel commedia.We travel to lots of cities worldwide and I must say this hotel rates amongst the best!! Friendly staff, centrely located and spacious rooms. My only gripe is the breakfast is very limited and there is no dinner service but apart from that I would recommend this hotel to my friends anytime. Irish Family.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,rooms fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: stubush
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel aprox 9am and were told that we were unable to check-in until 2pm, so we went for a walk. They went out of their way to get the room ready early for us, which was much appreciated! Our room was amazing (best we have ever stayed in) - 1st class decore and beautiful marble bathroom. There was also a wide screen TV with a choice of movie channels. The breakfast was delicious - There was a wide rage to suit everyone and the staff were excellent. The hotel is in perfect location - 5 mins walk to the Rialto Bridge and 10 to 15 mins walk to St Marks Sq. We would recommend going round some of the museums as they are very entertaining. We also went on a Gondolas, which was much fun (but expensive - worth it though!!) Couldnt stay in Venice for longer that 3 to 4 days as there was not much to do, but it was a brilliant trip and the hotel is fully recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “A delight from start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: SophiaLoren50
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in Hotel a la Commedia for 3 nights and enjoyed every moment. The hotel is quite easy to find being situated near the Rialto Bridge and we had a warm welcome when we arrived late at night, hungry and weary! The room was gorgeous, spotlessly clean and (for Venice) spacious. Comfortable beds, heavy curtains to block out the morning sunshine (yea!!) , flat screen TV with several English speaking channels, CD player and big wardrobes with lots of hangars (other hotels please take note). Excellent double glazing kept out any noise and so had great sleep every night. Not a huge choice for breakfast but what was there was good - fresh fruit salad (yummy), yogurts, cereals, breads, cheese and cold meats. It was possible to have hot food for an extra charge but I did not see anyone having any. Staff could not have been nicer, reception, dining room, porters, bar (had the best cappucino in Venice in the hotel bar and also had a Bellini cocktail which the barman expertly mixed up in front of us!) Room was serviced every day, with fresh bed linen and towels. Would highly recommend this hotel and will stay there when I go back to Venice. Excellent value for money even though I found Venice to be fairly expensive overall.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been four stars except for some service issues.”
Reviews.Author: Trekman
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel a la Commedia through Expedia based on recommendations on Trip Advisor. I booked for seven nights and based on that longer stay and my previous experience with very small rooms in European hotels, I decided to pay extra for a larger junior suite. I even confirmed this reservation with the hotel a week before arriving. When I checked in around 9:00 a.m. the desk clerk confirmed that I had a Junior suite but the room would not be ready until around 2:00 p.m. This was OK with me since I did not expect the room to be available that early. When I returned to the hotel later in the afternoon, the clerk said my room was now ready and a bell person escorted me to room 403 on the top floor. Although the room looked very nice and large enough I immediately noticed that it was definitely not a junior suite. I know that I should have immediately gone back to the check in clerk and rectified the situation, but I was so tired after the long airline flight and the room actually looked very nice and was plenty big enough for one person that I decided not to pursue the issue and get my trip off to a negative start. I never did find out why this happened, but my assigned room was so nice that I let it go. I only mention it here so that others are aware of this possibly happening to them, particularly if they are a solo traveler. In addition to this service issue, I also purchased 30 minutes of internet time for 8 euros. The wireless connection in my room worked well the first night, but then would not connect the next day. When I reported this to the desk clerk he just replied that the internet worked OK at his desk, but made no effort to fix the problem in my room. The internet was not crucial for me so I let this go also. While the above issues were disappointing, the hotel itself, its location, the excellent room I was assigned, were so nice that the service issues no way ruined my trip. Overall, I highly recommend this property, but advise others to be aware of some of the service issues I encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Central Location, Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Karen013
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel A la Commedia over Valentines Day and I can't recommend it highly enough. Venice is a beautiful city - although it is slightly faded elegance in parts - and this hotel stands out partially because it isn't faded at all (it is only about 5 years old - a rennovated bank building apparently) and partially because of its ideal location for all tourists. We had been recommended this hotel by friends and we weren't dissappointed (the trip advisor reviews were all positive too!) It isn't a cheap hotel but then no hotel in central Venice is! We booked online directly with the hotel website, and It really is worthwhile - they offer an 'early-bird' discount which was substantial and only available on their site. You had to agree that you couldn't get a refund if you cancelled and that you would pay for the room immediately on booking, but effectively we paid (for an upgraded deluxe room) for three nights only slightly more than the tariff rate for a standard room for one night. Breakfast is included in the price and is served in their elegant little breakfast room - I recommend the croissants! The location of the hotel is perfect, it really is less than a 5 minute walk away from the Rialto Bridge water bus stop (perfect is you have cases!); 5 minutes from the Rialto Bridge itself and about 10 minutes( depending upon how lost you get!) from St Marks Square. The hotel, other than the entrance, is above a street of designer shops just beside a lovely little square that has the best bakery imaginable! My recommendations for Venice are: * take comfortable shoes because you'll need them as you walk everywhere all the time! * forget about smart clothes to change for dinner because no-one does; * Try the spritz (it's the venetian speciality drink - you'll see everyone drinking it!); * try the bellini (peach & champagne drink); * if your budget will stretch (and I do mean stretch!) then go on a gondola ride, earlyish in the morning if you don't want your photo taken by everyone, it really is worth the money; * take a trip to Murano either on the waterbus or even better the glass factories will offer you a free water taxi ride out there if you loiter around St Marks Square(!) and then you only have to pay for the waterbus back - it is very beautiful island and if you love glass take your credit card! * If you are limited in time visit the Rialto Market early morning to see the fish & vegetable markets then onto the Basillica; have lunch in the Stable Bar in the Doge's Palace and finally go to the top of the Campanile for amazing view of Venice and the mountains on the mainland. Touristy I know but its the highlights of the city for those only there for the weekend; * Finally and most importantly take lots of money! Venice is not for those on a budget - we walked everywhere and maybe things were inflated in price because of the carnival but you won't get change of of 10 euros for two cups of coffee anywhere (make that 20 euros in St Marks Square!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: beazerChicago
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just loved this hotel. The staff was amazing, and even quite helpful in planning our days. They assisted in suggestions on restaurants, shopping, touring the venetian islands, etc... The room was beautiful, even a private terrace. This was one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in throughout Eurpoe. I would highly recommend. Also, great location, yet quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Simpatico Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYC_Ragazza
Reviews.Content: Loved this place! The excellent location made it possible to stop by the hotel during my travels around Venice to change clothes, drop off packages, etc. There was always a warm welcome and the accommodations were extremely comfortable. Breakfast was very filling and delicious. There is a cozy bar and lounge area. I would definitely recommend Hotel a la Commedia to any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in central position”
Reviews.Author: AlanSchofield
Reviews.Content: Like the other reviewers, found this hotel all we had hoped. Clean, comfortable, lovely bathroom, quiet yet central for all of Venice. We took a Alaliguna ferry from the airport to Rialto stop (euros 13 one way) and the hotel is a one minute walk. Found Venetian restaurants lacking (no surprises) and with the current weak pound very expensive, but snacking, coffees etc. still ok. The hotel's location means we could walk pretty much everywhere and we enjoyed seeing each of the areas, it is so lovely.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: AmericanExpat92
Reviews.Content: We have used Tripadvisor for years to plan and book our vacations. However, we have never written a review. After our fantastic stay at the Hotel a la Commedia, we decided we could not keep silent about this fabulous hotel! My husband and I traveled to Venice with our small children and my parents for 4 nights. It could not have been more perfect. The hotel's location is unbeatable! My father has knee problems and can not walk too far. Our location was so central that he had no issues with getting to all the sights and enjoying Venice. The rooms are beautiful and luxurious. I was impressed with the size, especially for an European hotel. We booked a Junior Suite and my parents booked a Regular Room. We both were very pleased. The service was excellent and very personal. Emanuel was a ray of sunshine every morning at breakfast. By the second morning, he had our cappuccinos and hot chocolates ready before we could ask. Some reviews commented on the "bad directions" given by the front desk. One thing we discovered rigth off, you will get lost in Venice. It is part of the charm of the city. No matter how detailed the directions, you will for sure get turned around. But don't worry...you will find your way.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Eric_C_W
Reviews.Content: We booked a junior suite as part of a package through Expedia. We booked early, before the economy tanked, the gas price went down, and the Euro went down. Nevertheless, we felt the hotel to be worth every penny. The location can't be beat. We had to fly out very early so we ordered a water taxi. The Grand Canal is only a block away so it was a easy walk with our luggage to the water taxi. It's a short walk from the hotel to San Marco square, Rialto markets. All the attractions are basically walkable, even though it was about 35 degrees and windy outside. We often had to walk back to the hotel to warm up. The rooms themselves were beautiful. One note: our bed was very hard, compared to what we sleep on at home.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was amazing!!!!!! WOW!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gdisney
Reviews.Content: When we booked our stay, we wanted 2 rooms next to each other, but when we got there we had 2 rooms across the hallway from each other! But we didnt care because our room had 2 plasma screen TVs in it a balcony and 2 massive beds! And even better the shop right underneath was ?Guess?! The best bed and breakfast ever.

Reviews.Title: “"Extortion on Christmas. A first for me"”
Reviews.Author: greenmount
Reviews.Content: The location is central, closest to Rialto Bridge. The facility is very nice, high quality and generally quiet, no complaints. The price is high but matched the quality. The problem was the service. First, arrived at 1:00pm after an overnight flight, and there wasn't even a smile or feigned apology that our room wasn't ready, rather "you're early, come back later (note, check-in was "after 2:00"). Then, when checking in, they tried hard to get us to upgrade our accommodations. When we told them "no" the next day, they informed us that they were going to charge us more for our existing accommodations because we "hadn't paid enough." Note, we had made the reservation and paid the necessary small fortune months in advance. Oh, and this all played out on Christmas Day. Some holiday...In the end, they didn't even service our room properly the last night. All in all, a very upsetting and totally insulting experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travellotte
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after finshing a cruise in Venice, we were not disappointed. We took a water taxi (80 euros) from the port to the hotel and with a 30m walk we arrived at the front entrance of the hotel. I have to recommend the taxi service, especially with luggage, Venice is not a place to be carrying luggage around! The hotel has a perfect location from which to explore Venice and we could not have asked for better. It is close to the Rialto bridge and an easy walk to St. Mark's Square. Check in/out was smooth, so smooth in fact that they managed to talk us into a shared gondola ride for 25euros each...well what else can you expect in Venice. The concierge was very helpful, the room was excellent, as was the included continental breakfast. My wife really appreciated the turn down service as well. We took the water taxi to the airport (100euros), organised by the hotel for us, worth every penny again and we walked 5 minutes to the terminal. They offer a bus (for a charge) but it really is too short to take the bus. Venice is pricey but we found the shopping to be excellent and the food to be well priced, don't forget most places charge to eat inside. Have some cannolo and coffee and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: eiljwor
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to Venice and sometimes manage to visit 2 or 3 times for short breaks. This is the 2nd time I have stayed at this particular Hotel and it just gets better. From checking in to checking out everything was excellent, staff are friendly but efficient and professional. The interior of the hotel is very chic and classy, and we had an awesome room on the first floor, spacious yet cosy with beautiful decor and a bathroom to die for. Breakfast is taken in a very attractive breakfast room and the food was fresh, plentiful with lots of variety. The location of the hotel could not be better, 5 mins walk to Rialto and 10mins to San Marco, shops within 200yds walk, and coffee shops and bars also very nearby. Venice in December is magical, despite there had been floods a week prior to our visit, the island was just as beautiful as ever. If you want to spoil yourself for 2/3 nights then enjoy the warm hospitality at Hotel A La Commedia. Venice Island

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at a La Commedia”
Reviews.Author: AJHEA
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel - small and refined yet with a friendly, relaxed atmosphere. The rooms have a classical modern style with elegant furnishings and a lovely luxury bathroom. (It's just as it's pictured in the brochure/on the internet). It's conveniently situated close to the Rialto bridge and St Marc's square and is an ideal base from which to explore Venice. The complimentary tour to the glass blowers on the Island of Murano was very enjoyable and we also received a complimentary gift of local biscuits as we were celebrating our birthday's during the stay. The hotel were happy to accomodate our 6 month old - providing a cot in the room (without extra charge) and a high chair at breakfast. The buffet breakfast was all very nice - although the selection could perhaps have been a bit more extensive/imaginative. Overall though this is a very good quality hotel and comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dublin user
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel a la Commedia for 2 nights in November. Really excellent hotel, very modern, spotlessly clean, friendly staff etc etc. Location was perfect, 3-4 mins walk from Mark's Square, 1 minute from Rialto water bus stop. Would recommend to others and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Fantastic City”
Reviews.Author: TigerTimUK
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights in Venice at La Commedia. Lived up to all our expectations based on previous reviews Fantastic quiet room (211), great service no complaints. There is paid Wifi but didn't bother to use so don't know cost. Breakfast OK not dazzling get there before 09:15 if you don't want to miss the crossants. Venice itself is wonderful but excruciating expensive with â‚¬3.50 ~ Â£3 coke the norm !! The self service buffet resteraunts are OK for lunch about Â£10 each. Airport Ferry direct to Rialto bridge @ â‚¬12 is the way to go ~ 50 minutes. So yes go to Venice for an amazing time and stay at the La Commedia but you'll need to sell your granny to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “A diamond in Venice”
Reviews.Author: speedymcqueen
Reviews.Content: My partner booked a surprise stay at La Commedia for three nights.We followed tips from other reviews on how to get from the airport to the hotel.Take the alilaguna public boat,orange line from stop 1 and get off near the Rialto Bridge.The walk to the hotel is only a few hundred meters,and is very easy even with luggage. We have stayed in similarly priced hotels in cities like Paris,Rome and Florence so I had some preset ideas of what the hotel room would be like.They were all completely wrong and the quality & cleanliness was far beyond my expectations.The decor is superb,we stayed in room 404 which had fantastic exposed beams,high ceilings and an expansive marbled bathroom.Staying in such luxurious surroundings certainly sets the tone of your stay in this amazing city. Breakfast was up to the standards of the rest of the hotel and the staff,particularly Emmanuel the waiter,were immaculately dressed and professional. As for Venice itself,a fascinating ancient place with views and photo opportunities on every street. Yes,it is very pricey especially with the current state of the euro but if you are prepared to wander off the main tourist streets there are plenty of places to eat and drink at reasonable places. If you are planning to visit Venice this hotel delivers on every level and even the most discerning customer would struggle to find fault with it!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: GOBLUE80
Reviews.Content: VERDICT: A La Commedia is a luxurious hotel in the heart of Venice. With spacious, comfortable and well appointed rooms, this hotel is highly recommended. BIGGEST COMPLAINT: Poor recommendations from the front desk staff for dining, directions, etc. Dining recommendations were very pricey and touristy. Directions were often confusing and not what we asked for (ex. asked for vaparetto stop, given different boat service stop). ROOM: We stayed in a junior triple suite that was very spacious and comfortable. The room was exceptionally clean and nicely decorated. We had lots of windows to let the cool Venice air flow through. Housekeeping and turn down service were great. The bathroom was the most spacious we had in Italy, with a nice tub/shower combo. AREA: Safe, well lit area with lots of shopping and restaurants close by; although you will have to walk a bit to find the non-touristy restaurants, grocery stores, etc. It's a short walk to the Rialto bridge, St. Marks Square and other attractions. It's off of a pretty quiet side alley, so noise wasn't an issue for us. SERVICE: As mentioned, housekeeping and turn down service were nice, but we were dissapointed with the front desk staff. We didn't like their recommendations for dining, or their directions for getting around (we did better just using a map and time tables). FOOD: Complimentary breakfast bar was good, but not much variety from day to day. GETTING AROUND: Be prepared for lots of map reading, Venice is quite complicated to get around. Walking wasn't really a problem, but the vaperetto routes and stops are confusing at first. Signage is very poor and the employees were not so willing to help out. VENICE RECOMMENDATION: Two days is more than enough in Venice. We had a 4 night stay, and by day 3 we were sick and tired of all the crowds, overpriced food and lack of things to do (besides site seeing). Venice is still a must see, but 2 days is plenty!

Reviews.Title: “Loved and appreciated the La Commedia on my first visit to Venice”
Reviews.Author: kwatkins1r
Reviews.Content: Loved this small intimate, very stylish Hotel. Was situated in a perfect position near the Rialto bridge, so close to everything. The staff were extremely courteous and helpful, sent us to a delightful nearby trattoria, Paridiso, took a great interest in us, what we were doing and going. The breakfast was excellent, and the lovely roof garden and bar added to the atmosphere. The rooms are lovely, a very stylish and comfotable and most welcoming stay. Would very much recommend. Thank you all at La Commedia you made our stay in Venice !

Reviews.Title: “Pefecto!”
Reviews.Author: Rubester1975
Reviews.Content: Myself & my new husband stayed here for our honeymoon from 13th Sept 2008 for 1 week. We had just had a week in Lake Garda (where we got married) staying in a supposedly 5 star hotel. I have to say that A La Commedia was soooo much better than our hotel in Lake Garda. From the moment we arrived we were treated really well, it helped that our room had been upgraded for our honeymoon and that they brought us a complimentary bottle of Prosecco, but the staff were friendly & helpful at all times. The hotel was in a fantastic location & it was great to be able to pop back during the day to drop off shopping or sit on our balcony watching Venice go by. The roof terrace is beautiful, peaceful, stylish & does a mean Bellini cocktail. I cannot praise this hotel enough & we will definitely be returning in the future to celebrate our anniversary.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Somewhere on the road between Sydney and Europe
Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: Intrepidtoo
Reviews.Content: This is a very well-run hotel. Everything is in good order and goes smoothly. Efficient, polite staff, clean and well-furnished rooms, both public and bedrooms. The hotel is close to Rialto bridge, with a vaporetto stop and also airport boat terminal. In the other direction, it is 10 minutes stroll to St Marks square, past some interesting shops. Rooms on 4th floor best, particularly 404. If you want a genuine Venice experience, you might not be happy here. The hotel could be anywhere, so if you would like to be in an old Venetian palace, on a canal, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton-Like”
Reviews.Author: TrueReport
Reviews.Content: Now. Here me when I say this: I NEVER do reviews like this...but since I used Trip Advisor while planning my trip, I thought I would give back. My wife and I were celebrating our 1 year anniversary this past week. We stayed in Venice for 3 nights at this hotel. I am a well traveled individual (having traveled to 30 countries in my short 29 years). One of our favorite places to say is the Ritz Carlton...and I must say, our room at this hotel was very close to that same quality. We had room 110 (which I am convinced is the worst room in the hotel...bottom floor next to the elevator). The location of the hotel was perfect. The location was so perfect that we would come back to the hotel for anything and everything...to drop off a small purchase, to grab a sweater, etc....The water bus drops off at Rialto Bridge and the hotel is a 45 second walk away. Also. The breakfast was great. Chocolate croissants every morning, with fresh fruit, juice, hot chocolate, O.J..... We did not find that the hotel staff were the best at recommending restaurants...so find your own places to eat. The photos on the hotel website are very accurate as to what the room looked like.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star!!”
Reviews.Author: Ollie90
Reviews.Content: Stunningly gorgeous hotel! Great location, not far from St Marks Square, but far enough away to provide a great nights sleep. Rooms are large, spotless, updated, and luxurious. Staff was extremely friendly and breakfast was excellent! We would stay there again on our next trip to Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ontario_Sun_lovers
Reviews.Content: This was the nicest room we had in Italy. The suite was spacious and modern. The room was beautifully decorated and spotless. It included all of the ammenities we had missed in other hotels in Italy. The staff were excellent and extremely professional. The roof top terrace is a great place to have a drink and relax after fighting the crowds of Venice. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - La Commedia”
Reviews.Author: robinjn1
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Venice and following research on Tripadvisor, decided that this was the hotel for us. We were not disappointed.Fantastic location just 2 minutes from Rialto Bridge and about 10 from St Marks square. We were in a junior suite. The standard of fixtures and fittings was excellent. Bathroom had excellent shower, bath, b-day, and all beautifully tiled; it had a really clean feel to it. We took our own travel kettle as we like a hot drink when we first wake up in the morning, and the mini-bar fridge was perfect for storing our own milk in. The double bed was a little on the hard side for us, but this is more a matter of personal preference. A room safe was available and the wardrobe was spacious and well lit with sufficient clothes hangars for the 2 of us. There were 2 televisions in the suite, with satellite channels and although the in room menu suggested that BBC was available, it was not and we had to make do with the American CNN. The standard of cleaning in the room was excellent. A roof bar is a new addition to the hotel. Here, there were fantastic views over the roof tops of Venice and it made a nice place to relax at the end of the day before sunset. The hotel provides breakfast only. This was a typical continental style with the usual selection of yogurts,cheese, ham, muesli and bread.There were always tinned peaches and some fresh melon and pineapple available. The hotel offered some trips and we decided to take the evening Gondola ride. Normal price for this 40 min round trip is 120euros up to 6 people. The hotel offered it for 25euros each which we paid and as expected they bundled us together with 4 others and off we went. We were disappointed because in spite of us having collectively paid 150euros (6 x 25) the Gondola looked completely indifferent, and offered us no commentary at all about what we were seeing. If we return to Venice, we will have no hesitation in booking this hotel again. For us, it ticked all the right boxes.

Reviews.Title: “you can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: Greyquill
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel. I usually can't say that about most hotels. It is very elegant, the front desk staff is very formal and well mannered. The rooms are decorated sumptuously in that opulent Venetian style. The bathrooms are all marble and chrome with bidets to boot. The breakfast is pretty good, the usual cereals and fruits, pastrie s and meats. The location is very good. Although difficult to find the first time. I recommend this hotel highly. The only negatve is that they do charge for the internet in 1/2 increments and there is only 1 computer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon, complete luxury”
Reviews.Author: TRossi81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed as part of our honeymoon trip to Italy and we loved every minute of our stay to La Commedia. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful and the room that we stayed in was nothing but complete luxury. On our first night we had to move to another hotel due to an electrical probably however it was to an upgraded hotel and on arrival back they upgraded our room and gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne, which went down a complete treat!! Everyone should visit this hotel, it's a dream come true!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: awrighty68
Reviews.Content: Would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone. We stayed at this hotel for my 40th birthday and the room, the friendly service of all the staff did not disappoint if anything it exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: FourPaws
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an amazing location and provides exceptional service. We spent a week here for our honeymoon and its the perfect location from which to explore Venice. The new roof terrace and bar is a gem - with seating/loungers in a beautiful setting (see photos). Go the third weekend in july and experience the Il Redentore fireworks - a 40 minute display fired from the Grand Canal! Downsides - we stayed in a standard room which was two single mattresses pushed together and there was no tea and coffee making facilities available. Cost of water taxis from the airport have gone up to 95euros so be prepared to haggle! We had a lovely stay here and would recommend you look no further in choosing a hotel to stay whilst in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: amcd4377
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four days at La Commedia in Venice. It was a beautiful hotel. The rooms were good sized (for European hotels especially) and clean. The hotel staff were friendly and knowledgeable. It was by far my kids' favorite hotel on our Italy trip. The location is great too - very easy walk to San Marco or Rialto bridge over to San Palo area.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous roof top terrace”
Reviews.Author: SignoraMarg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem! Just 100 meters or so from the hustle and bustle of the Rialto Bridge and the Grand Canal it sits in a quiet cul de sac. Only 20 or so rooms - all recently modernised and much larger than average. Fabulous roof top terrace with views of terracotta roofs and the Campanile in St Mark's Square clearly visible. Helpful concierge, front desk staff all of whom speak excellent English. Vaporetto stops for both the Grand Canal and the Venice Airport only 50 - 100 meters walk making it the ideal location. Although no in-house restaurant there are literally a handful of choices on your door step - one as soon as you walk out the front door. Room amenities and furnishings were beautiful and breakfast more than adequate. This hotel is a great find!!! Margaret W Melbourne, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mikefer
Reviews.Content: Hotel a La Commedia is a beautiful 4 to 5 star hotel in the heart of Venice just a couple of blocks from the Rialto Bridge. We just returned two days from a 14 day trip to Italy which included a day stay at La Commedia. Here are my top observations: 1) If you arrive by train take the water taxi (6 euros each), stop at the Rialto Bridge (not the Rialto market) and walk away from the bridge in the opposite direction. You have to carry your bag(s) over that step bridge but once over you'll come to an alley, walk down and the hotel is two blocks away in a small courtyard. 2) Hotel is new, beautiful, clean, well appointed and very comfortable. 3) Hotel is very expensive (especially if your reserving two adjoining rooms) but hey..your in Venice! 4) The staff is outstanding in every regard. Great English, very friendly and they treat you with real coutesy.The referred outstanding restuarants and made the reservations, walked us to the water taxi. Took care of everything. First class in every respect. Great place for families. 5) European breakfast buffet included which is very handy for maximizing your day. 6) 7 minute walk to Saint Mark's square. Again, the location is perfect. Surround by shops and stores and Gondola's they whole deal. 7) Great bathrooms, showers with good water pressure, the whole works. After traveling the country side, this was an oasis to land in and then go on to experience the city. Have an end of the day cocktail on the roof top terrace. You will love the view. Loved it......Dont' hesitate. this place is terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless Hotel in an Ideal Location!”
Reviews.Author: Fletts
Reviews.Content: Hotel A La Commedia is an absolute "find". The location is excellent, close to the Rialto, but quietly tucked away from the main thoroughfare. The rooms and public areas are spotlessly clean and appointed with state-of-the-art comforts. All staff were friendly and attentive, with a refreshing attention to detail. We requested a balcony and were given a room with two! We will unquestionably want to stay at the A La Commedia on our next trip to Venice. My only worry is that, by then, this hotel will have become so popular we can't get a reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Magic”
Reviews.Author: GillWUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real dream. The building and everything in it is gorgeous, and the staff are absolutely first class. Our stay was flawless and the whole ambiance of the hotel was wonderful. I'd go back there in a heartbeat, as there was everything you could possibly ask of a stay in such a romantic city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay & Location”
Reviews.Author: MDJDenver
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10 day trip to Venice, Rome and Florence. La Commedia was the perfect spot to start our vacation. The hotel is conveniently located a short stroll from the Rialto, San Marco and other areas. There was an ATM, pastry and small market (water, cola, etc) a few steps from the entrance. The hotel boasts of modern rooms and bath and they deliver with the added elegance of an old world feel. The bath had beautiful tile, gold mosaics, a tub with two shower options - handheld and rain head. The bath was deep and perfect for a soak after long days walking, Plenty of storage space, safe and mini fridge with reasonable prices for a hotel in Venice. The service at the front desk and breakfast area was above average. We booked a triple jr. suite for my mother, me and 11 year old niece. We had room 622 at the end of the corridor with two twins and a full size sleeper sofa which was very comfortable. The twin beds were comfortable however the pillows were very hard. The room had a desk and two chairs plus a long, narrow balcony overlooking a small quiet street. The balcony did not have a table or chairs which would have been a nice touch but we found ourselves looking over the ledge to the street below and rooftops. We paid $349 Euro per night plus tax inclusive of breakfast for three. We felt the rate was very reasonable for the space and amenities. Breakfast was ample with fresh pastries, yogurt, cheeses, meats, cereals, juices and an option for hot plates such as eggs, bacon and sausage (again, very reasonable costs). Coffee and hot cocoa was excellent and the service was fantastic. The staff treated my niece like a princess and applauded all of her efforts to speak Italian with the few phrases we taught her before leaving. We had very enjoyable meals at Aqua Pazzo and their sister spot a little further down on Piazza Santa Stephano which was a short stroll and felt so much more local than the other areas. We happened upon a music academy and could hear music from the windows and watched children at play on bikes and scooters as we enjoyed a light snack at a little cafe. We have stayed at much more expensive hotels in Venice....having stayed at La Commedia we have found a "home" in Venice. I would not hesitate to stay again or recommend this little gem to other travelers.....wonderful, wonderful stay. My only regret was not staying longer. On a side note, thanks to TA posters, we did the Secrets tour at the Doges Palazzoâ€¦.we very much enjoyed the tour and would recommend to other visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable!”
Reviews.Author: Sypas
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after doing lots of research and it was the best choice I could have made. Everything about it was fantastic. I wanted to make it special as I knew I was going to propose to my girlfriend at some point during our 2 night stay there. The hotel knew I was going to do this as I asked them for ideas, and when we arrived, they has upgraded us to a junior suite. The room was amazing, spotless, big, comfortable, quiet, etc. One of my biggest concerns about any hotel in Italy is the room size, but this hotel did not disappoint, aparently even normal rooms are good sizes. Location was excellent, I found that the Rialto side was more peaceful than the San Marco side. The service all the way through was 5 star, would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: carowin
Reviews.Content: There is nothing bad to say about this hotel. Its in a fantastic location, great service, beautiful rooms and good breakfast. When booking we found most hotels were expensive in the middle of Venice so while this is slightly pricey its not too bad in the grand scheme of things and definitely worth every penny. I would have no hesitation in booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “This is THE hotel to stay when in Venice”
Reviews.Author: catmarie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for five nights of our honeymoon, after leaving Rome. We had a Junior Suite which was extremely impressive to say the least. It was a spacious, relaxing, and comfortable room, which was decorated with great thought. Our suite was kept immaculately clean, with a nightly turndown service, with chocolates and weather forecast on our pillow. Breakfast is the usual continental, but we noted that eggs and bacon could also be ordered for an extra charge. The hotel is in a perfect location, just around the corner from the Rialto Bridge, and about ten/fifteen minutes walk from St Mark's Square. There is also the Alilaguna stop very nearby. The staff in the hotel could not have been nicer or more professional. We were also given a complimentary bottle of champagne to celebrate our honeymoon. We had a most enjoyable stay in this hotel and we were very sorry to have to leave. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: sauln78
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 wonderful nights in Venice staying at the a la Commedia. We can only agree with the other reviews of this hotel and say that it is trully fantastic. The standard of our deluxe room was very high with a superb marble bathroom with rain-fall style shower and deep bath. The turn down and maid services were excellent with chocolates left on our bed each evening. We also had a nice little balcony above the bustling street below. The staff were very attentive and knowledgable and the hotel have trips organised to Murano (the glass island) which is free and a shared gondola ride for which there is a charge. The bar area is small but nice and the buffet continental breakfast has lovely chocolate croissants and home made museli. Again the staff in both the bar and at breakfast were extremely friendly. They even gave me a bag of biscuits on my birthday which was a lovely touch. There isn't a lot more we can add that the others reviews don't cover. You will not be dispapointed if you book to go here. Venice is a wonderful enchanting city with lots to see and do and lots of places to eat to suit all budgets. Things to be aware of are that it is very busy with tourists of all nationalities. It is also very expensive. We paid on average 7.5 euros (Â£6.15) for less than a pint of beer and 5 euros (Â£4) for a cup of tea. You won't find anything much cheaper than that in the city. Meals can be expensive also but there are many options.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: d_nathan_99
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying here for two fantastic nights. 11th - 13th March. We booked through Citalia (who were fantastic). A La Commedia is in the most amazing location (2 minutes to Rialto Bridge and 5 mins from St Marks Square). There are a selecting of restaurants close by and designer shops next door! The rooms are spacious and the decor is divine. The finishing touches to the room are spectacular. The reception staff were helpful andgave great advise about the area. I would like to go back this year and will look to stay here first. You won't go wrong at this hotel. ** Charming, Stylish and a real pleasure ** If you want a bath in your room always request this as they will allocate a disabled room!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful - all that we hoped for and more”
Reviews.Author: GrahamAndRuth
Reviews.Content: Booked holiday via independent company called classicitalia.com. Very helpful and provided holiday much cheaper than via Expedia, etc. Hotel was excellent - recently refurbished and it showed. Room facilities were excellent, clean and to a very high standard. Hotel reception staff very friendly and helpful - recommending local restaurants, etc. I would like to make a comment about the maid service too - exceptional in terms of cleaning, etc and they even provided a little card detailing the next day's weather and a couple of chocolates when they had been been to turn down the beds. It's little touches like that which made this such an enjoyable experience. Couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough and would DEFINITELY return here, despite the high prices for food, etc that seem to be standard in Venice. Altogether a very enjoyable holiday experience. Graham + Ruth

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: ericnorth
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a fantastic location, about a 1 to 10 minutes walk from most of Venice's activities. Nice comfortable rooms, large marble bathrooms but the plus is the staff, in one word fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: lucy981
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic stay in Venice, and found this to be a fantastic, friendly, well located hotel. The convenience of being such a short walk from the main attractions is amazing. the front desk staff is incredible they always try to help(with gondolas, tours and restaurants). very nice experience, i can`t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelminx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon and had a great time. The hotel is well located, well staffed and very nicely decorated. We wanted a modern hotel and were very pleased with our choice. The staff were all helpful and friendly, the breakfast buffet was good, the room, bed and bathroom were all great. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Greesa2
Reviews.Content: A really fantastic hotel in a stunning location just two minutes walk from the Rialto bridge. The hotel is modern, spotlessly clean and welcoming and the staff were very friendly and willing to help. Our bedroom was delightful and very luxurious, a real haven of warmth and comfort. The hotel bar was great for an evening cocktail and the staff helped sort out both a gondola ride and a taxi trip to Murano to see the glass factories. Overall, highly recommended as a great hotel in a superb central location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and truly memorable experience!”
Reviews.Author: HoneyChandlersFord
Reviews.Content: The Hotel A La Commedia made our recent stay in Venice a truly memorable and special one! The hotelâ€™s location and facilities were excellent, and all staff extremely pleasant and helpful. Our 'standard' double room was more like a mini-suite - the quality of the decor and fixtures/fittings in the bedroom & bathroom was superb! We especially appreciated the excellent maid service, and were delighted to find the chocolates on our pillows on the 1st night of our stay! A lovely â€˜extraâ€™ touch! Breakfast was also delicious with an extremely extensive range of choice! We would not hesitate to book again in the future, and have recommended highly to friends and family. If you travel to Venice, trust us, there is no better place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: simonbarnes
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the Hotel A'la Commedia just before Christmas and it was fantastic. The rooms were very comfortable and luxurious. The staff were very friendly and we particularly enjoyed the breakfast. The hotel is perfectly situated. It is a couple of minutes from the Rialto Bridge and St Marks Square is a leasurely 6 or 7 minutes walk. Highy recommended and we cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: munocheney
Reviews.Content: stayed 5 nights from jan 6th i must say that we have stayed in all major cities in italy and this hotel rates as the best. for room size we had the deluxe quality of interior and service and specially location we will definatley return and recommed to all.(we are also hoteliers)keep up the good service a la commedia Thanks.......,( just as a note of caution avoid eating at the restraunt just outside the hotel nothing to do with the hotel ). Manjit and Rajita...

Reviews.Title: “I doubt the management at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelVoila
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and I booked a honeymoon couple at this hotel for a 3-night stay in July, 2007. I booked the hotel through a hotel reservation system which has existed for a long time and is heavily used by travel agents. After 6 months, I still have not received a commission from this hotel. It seems that the management holds scant regard for those who work hard to give them business and fill their rooms every night. Is this how the hotel treats its guests?

Reviews.Title: “A dream Hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: afrequentvisitor
Reviews.Content: I am a regular visitor to Venice and visit at least 3 times a year, I have just returned from a 4 day visit with my sister, we stayed in a hotel which was new to us. Hotel a la Commedia, perfect in every way, rooms were modern with a traditional twist, spotless and clean and a bathroom to die for. Location was spot on also, just off the Campo San Luca 5 mins walk to Rialto Bridge and 10 mins from San Marco. It is situated in a quite little corner, away from the noisy alley ways. Breakfast was superb, everything you could wish for, and served in a smart breakfast room with pleasant staff. We had drinks in the bar also served by smart and efficient staff, and the prices were not extortionate. The bar was furnished with comfortable chairs and was beautifully decorated, with flowers and christmas floral bowls. I could have sat there all evening. Reception staff were excellent, helpful,polite but also very friendly. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. I have already booked to go again and take my husband for a special birthday treat. Looking forward to the next visit. My last and final comment is that I cannot praise it enough !!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel for service and location”
Reviews.Author: callasBelfast
Reviews.Content: Date 25/11/2007 I have just returned to Belfast after spending 4 nights in your beautiful hotel and would like to thankyou for a most enjoyable stay.Your hotel was excellent and the staff so very helpful and courteous. It's location was also a big bonus. Venice is so very beautiful and it's history is fascinating, no doubt I will return one day and will certainly stay in A La Commedia again! Regards Clare Doherty

Reviews.Title: “4 nights in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Brightside54
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in Venice in the care of La Commedia hotel and although I had read some "horror" reviews on TripAdvisor prior to going we were very impressed with this hotel. We were placed on the 3rd floor in a standard double but the room was superb with probably the best bathroom we had ever encountered and it even came with a small balcony from where we could see the Campanile in San Marco. The hotel staff were excellent and very friendly as were the waiters in the breakfast room, all in all we could not fault it and would certainly recommend staying there. I did investigate the previously reported "noise problem" one night and found one bar, separate from the hotel, that was noisier than the others but as the receptionist commented later it is very quiet in Venice late at night (no traffic etc.) and I'm not sure what could be done as I'm sure the bar will have a licence. We certainly could not hear a thing and had 4 excellent nights stay. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay in Venice and would recommend: a) Bascilica di San Marco, be there for 9am to get in as soon as the doors open (9:30) and go upstairs (extra â‚¬3) b) Campanile di San Giorgio, excellent views from the bell tower (see photo) c) Alla Zucca, a trattoria in Santa Groce district (excellent for vegetarians) d) Bacaro Jazz, just for the music, late night entertainment and the ceiling! e) Good walking shoes, then take a few hours wandering through the narrow streets, you will probably get lost but continue and you will find yourself back where you started

Reviews.Title: “TOO NOISY!! UNRESPONSIVE MANAGEMENT”
Reviews.Author: babettetravels
Reviews.Content: It's not worth the money, we had two torturous evenings. Taken in by the charming photographs and other travelers' reviews, we booked the expensive and small suite for over 400 euros a night. It was terrible. Located under the bar, all night you could hear people walking around, moving chairs, and the like. Indeed, the noise echoed through our small suite. We spent two nights tortured by this noise -- which did not cease until well after 1:00AM which was especially deadly on our departure morning which required a 4:30AM wake-up. When we complained about the noise, we received shrugs. It seems that the noise occurs when all managers with any power are gone and as we spent our days touring Venice we never talked to anyone "in control." I sent an e-mail when I returned to the US to advise management of the issue and have yet, three months later, to recieve even a courtesy reply.

Reviews.Title: “A La Commedia - A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Advisor20
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights with the hotel after reading the reviews in Tripadvisor. We weren't disappointed as the hotel is lovely and in a great location. Our room was quiet with good soundproofing on the windows. The staff were all excellent and spoke very good English (and by all accounts several other languages!) The room was very plush and the bathroom was beautiful. We requested a quiet high room away from the lifts and got that. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Venetian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrekGirl
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a great location. There were three of us staying in a junior suite. We stayed for 5 nights and couldn't have asked for a better stay. The men at the front desk were so accomodating and friendly. While one female breakfast room was on the grumpy side, the young man who worked there was wonderful. When he came across us on the rooftop one afternoon, he immediately went and got out pads for the lounge chairs and asked if we would like blankets and pillows for a nap. Yes, the beds were on the stiff side (but after our stay in Paris, they actually seemed pretty comfortable). I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice hotel, bad beds”
Reviews.Author: caviargal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located and quiet with lovely bathrooms, very clean and nice rooms. Beds and pillows were like boards, however, and I was glad we were only there for 2 nights. Limited public areas and surly breakfast service were the downsides. Also, staff was not helpful prior to check in with requests. Might stay here again for a short stay at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mangare_e_Bere
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research online looking for a hotel to stay at for four nights in Venice. Trip Advisor was a major influence in my decision to contact Hotel a la Commedia and ultimately book a junior suite there. We just returned from our trip, and I am so happy that we chose this wonderful hotel. The hotel may say Four Star Deluxe, but the service is Five Star, with a tremendously gracious, classy, professional group of gentlemen behind the front desk. They speak excellent English, and are very helpful and nice. They even confirmed all of the dinner reservations I had made before we arrived from Tuscany. We stayed there with another couple, us in a junior suite, they in a deluxe double. Both rooms were quiet, very clean, spacious, and comfortable. The beds are firm (which we like) and the bathrooms are spotless (the shower is to die for). Be sure to have a cocktail at the rooftop bar or in the lobby, the bartender is a great guy. I give this hotel my highest recommendation. Bravo La Commedia!

Reviews.Title: “Venice 2007”
Reviews.Author: lingor
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for most sites. Staff very willing to assist. Emanuele especially so. Breakfast plentiful. Rooms extremely comfortable and maintained to a very high standard. Only criticism was that the reception booked four water taxis to take ten people to the airport for the same flight, said that it was impossible for them to change from four taxis as they had already booked them, as the fare to the airport was 110 euros, we thought it could have been made much less pricey to share.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dollbaby
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Rooms very luxurious. Great location. Lovely buffet breakfast. Staff all friendly and helpful. View of a wall from our room but very quiet and we weren't expecting any views anyway. Liked the flat screen tv but agree with previous comment that would have liked the dvd film to change during the week(not that we were in much to watch tv) Also agree that coffee in St Marks square expensive but worth it!!!! Receptionist booked us on to a gondola ride with 3 other people for 25 euros each which saved us having to haggle with the gondoliers. Handy to get the Allelungha boat to the airport. All in all a great stay. Venice really is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: LoveItaly49
Reviews.Content: What an amazing hotel! Staff were friendly and welcoming after a long trip from the US. Room was beautiful, in creams, white and gold. Felt like royalty. Great location - near the Rialto bridge and a short walk from Piazza San Marco. Breakfast was generous and staff again, outstanding - helpful and quick service. Would stay here again, and again. Will recommend to friends and family. Love it, want to go back today!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: sallymc
Reviews.Content: A really lovely hotel with lots of Italian charisma ! Lots of cream granite everywhere,which felt really luxurious.The breakfast was lovely,and the rooms were wonderful.Very friendly ,helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Well recommended”
Reviews.Author: UkCarlos
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay at the Hotel a La Commedia at the end of September based upon other Tripadvisor reviews and it did not disappoint. As it was refurbished in 2006 the hotel is modern and contemporary, staff helpful and friendly, breakfast very good. It was also extremely easy to find, just off the main canal near Rialto bridge. Excellent value for money, well recommended. Recommend an evening drink upon the terrace bar on the top floor of the hotel. Although it lacked atmosphere as there were not many people using it at approximately 10pm we felt it was relaxing to have a night cap and take a look at the roof tops of Venice, which was an a different view to what you see when walking around during the day. Extremely minor recommendations would be to include bath robes and change the DVD on the film channel which was the same for the whole three nights we were there. Our room was on the 1st floor which was located above a shop, so during the day we could hear music coming from the shop. However, as the shop closed late afternoon it didnâ€™t bother us too much.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but room 114 oh so noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Traveljunkie2801
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Venice and the A La Commedia and as an avid trip adviser user cannot believe the review I have just read regarding room 114 why didnt I look at this site before I left! However, first of all arrived at the airport and thought blow the budget we will have a private water taxi what a great way to arrive in Venice absoulutly a must do and worth every cent of the 90 Euros you feel like a film star as you zoom under the Rialto bridge. Hotel is ideally placed for everything 2 minutes from the Rialto and about 5 from St Marks provided you dont get lost which of course you will do repeatadly, but this is all part of the charm of Venice. We stayed for 3 nights in the Hotel and it is fantastic the staff are brilliant and the terrace bar stunning, HOWEVER.............on our 2nd night the bar underneath room 114 was a little loud but nothing in comparison to the following night when returning to our room at 11.00pm it was like being in a nightclub......the walls were vibrating I kid you not!..........in addition there were around 50 people standing in the square singing and dancing and the bar also has some sort of car horn going as well....phoned reception and was told Hotel was full and so cannot move you it will stop around 2am!......tough.......phoned again at 1pm and 1.30pm and the hotel apparently told them to turn it down................3am it eventually finished!...............spoke to the manager the next day and blew my stack after no sleep, he assured me it was a rare event to go on so late and as a token wrote off our 90 Euro bar bill. However the Torino bar is directly under rooms 114, 115 and 113 and 213, 214 and 215 etc going up the hotel, if you are allocated any of these rooms refuse it unless you are going to the bar or an Insomniac..............for the 2 nights after we left the bar was advertising music till 2am so this is not a RARE event it is a regular event. Other than that Venice is as you expect it to be beautiful and timeless but so expensive..............Hotel will offer to book you a Gondola for 120 Euro you can get it for a around 75 if you haggle and restaurants there are 100s probably 1000s and we didnt have a bad meal. Coffee in St Marks Square is as you would expect a wallet clinching experience but one that has to be done so don't fight it, we went to Florins as its the oldest one in the square the waiter was miserable and 2 coffees and 6 biscuits was 35 Euros! St Marks Bassilica is stunning as is the Doge's Palace. There are lots of beautiful squares to have coffee and people watch, we also went to a Vivaldi concert in San Stefano Church which was amazing. We walked everywhere as the weather was great and its the best way to see this fantastic city. So enjoy the experience and don't worry about what its going to cost you have to do it all regardless of the cost and what's more they know it!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking Venice and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: CherylBerkshire
Reviews.Content: We left for Venice on 10 Sept and I did have a few misgivings about my holiday that week from reports I had been reading - silly me! After a smooth flight from Gatwick we arrived at Venice Airport and were waved through by immigration and through the arrivals hall after collecting our one suitcase (travelling light pays off) and approached the Motorscafi desk just opposite on the right and booked a water taxi with a quote of 100e which included the bus to take us down to the dock. We decided to walk down with our case under a covered walkway and it was only 5 minutes - this was 90e. It's really so close so just walk down. We gave over our ticket and boarded our James Bond motor boat and were exploded from the dock - you have got to enter Venice this way; it was thrilling. As we approached Venice I got a bit misty eyed to see this sight after so many years of longing to - so different, so old and so lovely with the gondolas which were bigger than I had imagined and the gondoliers in their navy striped shirts and boaters - just magical. We docked at the Rialto Municipal stop and although I was worried that the hotel would be far away it was a mere 30 metres to the right then turn left and 20-30 metres at the Calle del Carbon and the hotel is there. The hotel is a 4 star and some have suggested it should be a five star but I think it's a really nice small 4 star. The reception was very friendly and helpful (not to mention good looking) and we were shown up by a bell boy to the second floor where our room faced the front of the hotel. The room was bigger than I imagined and all done in gold and cream with a huge queen bed and canopy above. The bathroom was reported as being huge - no it wasn't but was adequately fitted out with a great shower that had a head the size of a dinner plate and therefore, made you feel as if you were under a waterfall. The roof terrace on the 4th floor was absolutely lovely with new black cane furniture, a bar and barbecue all surrounded by geraniums and a view of San Marco's campinile in the foreground. Lovely place for an evening drink. Breakfast room was pretty and continental breakfast was adequate and hot stuff extra. Wish they did just plain croissants without apricot and chocolate inside - and some toast wouldn't go amiss either. Staff seemed slightly stretched and a bit forgetful at times although it was busy. Nice times from 0700-1030 lots of scope. We went out for a light lunch straightaway and started to wander up and down bridges, down alleyways with washing hanging overhead and people everywhere! It was crowded especially around the Rialto Bridge area which we always tried to avoid and had much more fun wandering the back streets and coming across new squares and churches and markets and a real taste of ordinary people's lives. The hotel had offered us a trip to Murano but when I said that this would only be a one way trip if we didn't buy anything he realsied that I was aware of this. We took a boat trip to Burano on the BURANO ferry itself and it was a lovely one hour trip to a very pretty multi coloured fishing village and famous for its lace which I must say isn't my thing but the peace and tranquility after Venice was welcome. We had a lovely lunch and in the small fish restaurant met a fellow Brit who had decided to actually live on Burano and loved it although he still worked somehow for the BBC - would be a bit quiet and cut off for me. We got used to the ACTV line and all the stops along the grand canal and decided to take the boat bus over to the Ferrovia train station and catch a train to Verona. The fare was 12e each and the ticket people quite helpful. So unusual to take a boat to the train station steps and get on a train going everywhere. There was a fast train, slow train, Eurostar and the Orient Express. The trains are efficient and clean and only delay was on the return journey which was unusual. Verona was lovely and like a smaller version of Florence. We went to see the 2,000 year old amphitheatre where the Verona Opera is held - last one on Sept 1st. This is second to the Coliseum in Rome and was a magnifent structure of ancient times. Went and had a nice lunch with the best white wine so far and strolled and sat for coffee and strolled some more. Suddenly turning my head left I spied the famous Romeo & Juliet balcony and we took a snap (it's only a myth you know). When you come out of Verona station you have to take the 11,12 or 13 number bus into the city centre. I have to admit we just jumped onto a bus with the crowds as we were'nt sure where to get tickets from. Verona was lovely and again a break from Venice. The food in Venice is mostly fish based which I love but my partner doesn't so we had to compromise although on the whole the food was great and only one bad experience (for me anyway) and it had to be a pizza! When my ordered anchovy and black olive pizza was brought to me I thought what's that, where's the anchovies? The base was rock hard and I only managed to eat the centre and that was hard work. When he came to collect the plates I felt like putting my ring of pizza over his head like a halo! One restaurant that was nice and peaceful and good service and food was Anonimo Veneziano, Calle del Fruttariiol nr. Campo San Marco Tel: 041/5289730. This was good old fashioned service and the food was good and reasonable 63e including wine and beer. San Marco square itself is magnificent but those pigeons I can do without-they shouldn't encourage them by feeding them - s and feathers everywhere - wait till the evening to go there much more romantic especially walking down to the sea and the entrance. I had had my eye on some Murano glass goblets which were in a little shop past the Hotel Bonvecchiati which was near the Commedia, They were a good price and the chap inside very helpful without the hustle. He displayed them for me and I chose 3 gorgeous colours (red not being a colour I like in anything), all edged in 22 carat filigree. He wrapped them up so carefully for the flight home and I was very happy with the purchase and the service. The Bonvecchiatti is a lovely 4 star hotel too larger than a la Commedia and quite plush and the dining terrace they have with piano playing looked really nice to have dinner there. We treated ourselves to dinner at a pricey restaurant on the third night and this is Do Forni on google for details I know. Part of it is designed liked the Orient Express but we choose the main dining room which was lovely and we were led to our table by the maitre de. The whole menu looked delicious and the flavours were wonderful. The service was immaculate and the head waiter was first class. However, things happen and the very nervy trainee waiter under the watchful eye of the head waiter picked up my bottle of wine from the ice bucket and proceeded to pour this into my partner's beer! Boy did he get it in the neck - from the far side of the room by the head waiter! Apart from this which was funny really and the drinks were replaced, the ambience and food etc were great - the bill came to 160e for a beautiful fillet mignon buttery peas and dauphonoise potatoes and a whole grilled sea bass with buttered asparagus with parmesan followed by an especially large piece of lemon merangue for my partner (to compensate for his beer having wine added to it) and my creme caramel which was sublime. This restaurant was worth it and well recommended especially by my work colleague - he was right. We roamed everywhere so ladies comy shoes and those pretty thonged sandals could be murder on the toes after a few hours, How to dress- well I'd say stick with pretty and cool - only jeans and trainers if the weather isn't too warm but even then I wouldn't wear them in Venice. The Italians are so stylish and the way they wear jeans and a white shirt and their shades and lovely shoes, will outdo anyone. Just be comfortable and take lots of rests for wine or coffee. Now the last thing I had to do was hunt down Campo San Barnaba as this was where the 1950's film Summer Time was filmed by David Lean with Katherine Hepburn and Rossano Brazzi and I did find the little antique shop where they met etc and it was just the same inside almost but now a mask shop. Brilliant old film which captures Venice so well and my quest was complete. The lady in the shop had a dvd running of the film and made the most of its film connection although some Americans in the shop didn't have a clue about its background even though they were of the right age, The owner however remembered Rossano Brazzi well (Richard Gere of the 50's) and I don't think it was all for his acting!! I agree with her. Well, Venice surprised me and delighted me all at the same time and I hope one day to go back. I felt I didn't want to leave as we sped away in the motor boat (100e booked by the hotel with the bell boy taking your suitcase down to the waiting taxi for you). Pure class and as I sat in bed watching the latest James Bond movie with the closing scenes set in Venice and knowing that I was actually in the real set at that moment - well just fantastic. Any questions just fire away and please don't put off your trip anymore just book it and experience a world apart in just 2 hours. Ciao for now Cheryl

Reviews.Title: “A Tastte of Heaven on Earth”
Reviews.Author: Shakers_7
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to Italy and we had gotten used to the small rooms and hard beds. Nestled in a quiet area but extremely close to the St. Mark Square and the main shopping attractions is this extremely sophisticated modernized and spotless clean hotel with incredibly spacious rooms and a nicely decorated and equipped bathroom that is very inviting after the hustle and bustle of a day in Venice. The list of amenities is long as are the perks that the rooms enjoy including a huge plasma tv screen, a CD player, large comfortable beds, adjustable room temperatures, and a very cozy atmosphere. On the day we were supposed to check out, my husband and I went for our last shopping spree in the very tempting elegant shops of Venice. We left my elderly mother behind with a promise to be back in time for the check out as the hotel was booked solid. Due to a protracted payment procedure at one of the shops, we were one hour late for the check out. Not only was the staff accomodating and incredibly gracious to my mother, they also started helping her in trying to reach us on our cell phones, making every attempt to soothe her frayed nerves. When we came back and profously apologized, they were even more gracious and welcoming. We promised to share our experience with the Trip Advisor fans, and we are happy to do so. Definitely, a place to go back to, even if pricey. It is worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “A Venetian Jewel!”
Reviews.Author: Thweety
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel a la Commedia for two nights prior to a Med cruise. The time I spent researching Venice hotels paid off well in finding this wonderful oasis in a busy tourist mecca. I wish I had taken as much care in investigating how to get to the hotel. There were four of us and we should have opted for the more pricey water taxi. But we opted for the cheaper water bus and after being told incorrectly what bus to take, we found ourselves heaving our luggage over the steps of the bridges. But that was my fault. But the sight of the hotel was a welcome one! The staff was so very nice and helpful. One of the front desk fellows even walked us to a restaurant he recommended saying it was no bother...he could use some air. The hotel is beautiful and in a great location near the Rialto bridge and the Piazza San Marco. We wanted to stay in that area rather than having to ferry back to the less expensive areas since we had such a short time there. After the crushing crowds of the daytime a bit of peace comes at nightfall. We discovered an excellent restaurant on the other side of the Rialto bidge: RISTORANTE FLORIDA. Try it...a beautiful setting along the canal with superb food. Now to the hotel: LOVELY! The hotel is only a year old and it is impeccable. It is like a mini-Versailles. The bathroon is equipped with every amenity with inlaid gold accents, granite and a sumptuous tub and shower. The walls of the room are covered in silk with braided cording and the bed also has silk draping. There is state-of-the-art electonics and flat screen tv. The rooftop terrace is a relaxing and beautiful place to have a pre-dinner drink. There is a nice continental breakfast provided in the morning.Considering the quaIity of the hotel, the great location and the high cost of everything in Europe, I found this hotel to be a good value! I am in the travel business and I have shared this wonderful hotel with my agents.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireSkiers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights from Friday, 17 August. The photographs on the hotel's web site are honest. This place is a real gem, do try it. The hotel isn't just clean, it sparkles! The room was beautifully appointed and the bathroom was luxurious. The bed linen and towels were changed daily. Staff were attentive and couldn't do enough to help with any request. Breakfast was good quality and there was plenty of choice. It is situated only a short distance from the Rialto Bridge so is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like A Princess”
Reviews.Author: CiaoBonita
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely beautiful and I felt like a princess. The staff was very kind and helpful. This is the type of place that is perfect for a honeymoon or special occasion. It is located in an excellent location very close to the Grand Canal and the Rialto bridge. The breakfast is included and very decent. I would definitely go there again. My only complaint is that the bed was a little hard but that wouldnt be enough to keep me away!

Reviews.Title: “Great Venice hotel”
Reviews.Author: zoob1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the A La Commedia on two separate days, before and after a cruise which began and ended in Venice. the Hotel is brand new, very clean and our room was luxurious. Great location, between St. Marks and the Rialto bridge. It's about 200 yards from the Rialto, so it's an easy trek from a taxi or vapporatto stand to the Hotel (although you need very precise directions to know which alley to turn into to reach the Hotel). The Hotel porter carted our bags right to the taxi stop at the canal for us. We lost ALL of our luggage when we landed at the Marco Polo airport in Venice (due to a missed connection in Frankfurt - don't book connecting flights to Europe!!). The front desk manager was a tremendous help in working with the airport to locate our luggage, and we were in awe that our lost luggage was waiting for us when we got to the cruise ship. A week later, the manager greeted us by name when we returned. A very positive overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel on our trip”
Reviews.Author: DADeetz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect. First Class room. We had a Junior Suite, it was immaculate, fresh, and the A/C worked amazingly. Many Italian hotels the A/C just works, and it was humid when we were there. Staff was most helpful, location was fabulous for walking to everything (only a few steps from Grand Canal) and the breakfast was very substantial for continental. The Breakfast room staff was always cleaning, and keeping the tables turned so you never had to wait to be seated. I highly recommend this hote for anyone, no matter how picky you are, (I am very OCD when it comes to cleanliness) A bit pricy, but for Venice, not a bad deal at all, you won't be disappointed. I'm sure this hotel would be a 5 star if it had a regular restaurant. Dennie Deetz

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Eloise67
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the A La Commedia for four nights as a single traveller in July. The hotel made me feel welcome and It made my stay in Venice a fantastic experience. Would I stay here again, yes definately. The staff were polite and helpful nothing was ever too much trouble. The room 106 was a double room it was immaculate, stylish and comfortable. If you want to experience Venice and you want great accommodation this is the place. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: HRAJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights as a family of four and my wife's parents. We were later joined by my brother-in-law.Between us we had four bedroomsand they were all immaculately clean.The A/C worked efficiently and we did not hear any sounds from anywhere else. I slept much better than I usually do in hotels. The maids attend twice a day and there is a nice turn-down service. The staff are all very friendly and speak good English. The roof terrace has furniture and is a lovely way to unwind , have some hot drinks , nightcaps and cocktails ,look at the sky and the Campanile of San Marco and the folks down on the street. The location is fantastic. My mother-in-law does not walk well , but the Piazza di San Marco is only 10-15 minutes walk away and the Rialto bridge is less than 5 mins.The No 1 vaporetta stop is only 2 mins away down a side alley. The breakfast is elementary , but quite adequate.It would be much better if they also provided a full hot buffet breakfast inclusive. I would stay here again.I hope that it maintains its standards , because I understand that it has only been open for less than 12 months.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy room 114, though hotel room was beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Itali0phile
Reviews.Content: We stayed Tues, Wed & Thu night in early June at A La Commedia. We were shown to a beautiful room, number 114, overlooking Campo San Luca. However on returning to our room at 10:30pm we could not believe the level of noise in there. It was as though there was a live band playing in our room! Because we didn't know where it was coming from, when looking through the windows, which were tightly shut, we assumed that it was one of the locals with their stereo turned up very loud. The noise, which was impossible to block out even with ear plugs, eventually stopped at 3am. The next day we discovered that a bar called Torino @ Notte was directly underneath our room and the bar displayed a sign to show that they play live music at night until 2am. We asked at hotel reception if we could change rooms, but were told that the hotel was full and that "that bar is usually a quiet bar". We endured a further 2 nights of excruciatingly loud music and on returning home discovered that Torino @ Notte is one of the few places in Venice (La Serenissima?!) that is known for loud music. Well that is the bad bit. The good part is that the hotel room was beautiful, though we had no safe due to the room being so recently refurbished. Everywhere in the hotel was lovely and clean. The breakfasts were excellent and it was no trouble for the waiter to bring us a Macchiato, when asked, to go with them.
