Because we arrived relatively late in the evening on our first night, we asked for a recommendation from the hotel of somwhere to eat. I had read, on the internet, about a place called Bancogiro, but the receptionist said that he did not know it and advised us to go to Trattoria alla Scala, about 10 minutes away. When we eventually found alla Scala, the food was pleasant, though the scallops were a little gritty, and the few other diners there also seemed to be from A La Commedia. The next day we walked over to the Rialto market, which was less than 5 minutes from the hotel and there in Campo San Giacometto was Bancogiro and also another highly regarded restaurant Naranzaria. We ate at Bancogiro on the 2nd night. The food was of excellent quality and very good value. Staff were very friendly. Bancogiro's location is also great, because you can eat outside overlooking the Grand Canal! For those of you who have seen the latest Bond movie, Casino Royale, these 2 eateries are where the scene where diners get up from their seats in shock at the sight of the building opposite crumbling into the water were filmed. On our last night we ate at Osteria da Alberto in Cannaregio and can't recommend it enough - great food and, once again, very friendly staff. Try the Fragolino and Venetian biscuits. Also worth a visit is Al Bottegon, a little old fashioned bar near the little bridge in San Trovaso, opposite a Gondola workshop. They serve great cicchetti and drinks or coffee. There is standing room only, but it is a real Italian experience and we were grateful of it when we ran in out of the rain on our walk around the Accademia area. We would stay at A La Commedia again, but only if we could be guaranteed a peaceful bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Spicerd
Reviews.Content: My family of five just completed a two night stay at Hotel a La Commedia and absolutely loved it! I was nervous about it because I had only stayed at the Bauer for previous visits to Venice, but the Bauer was unavailable...the best thing that could have happened! We had a double Junior Suite and a triple Junior Suite and the rooms were just wonderful...everything was maximum comfort and the staff was attentive, english speaking and enthusiastic... As has been repeatedly mentioned, the location is great, with easy walking access to everything...no canal view, but the canal view we have had in the past (at the Bauer) is so straight down, it doesn't really lend itself to a relaxed looking out over the canal... so, we didn't miss the canal view at all... The Hotel a La Commedia will definately be our hotel of choice for future trips to this wonderful city...

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Hotel a La Commedia!”
Reviews.Author: southpaw5
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned to the US from our 10th anniversary vacation in Italy and wanted to say that the La Commedia was by far the best hotel we stayed during our entire two week trip throughout Italy. The incredibly spacious rooms and superb service were top notch. The daily breakfast was excelent and the caffe served was so good, I've ordered some to be shipped back home. Its location is centrally located near the Rialto bridge which made everything very convienent. We would not hesitate to highly recommend Hotel a La Commedia to fellow travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Total disaster”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler87354
Reviews.Content: What a disaster! The entire staff we dealt with at this hotel was both rude and incompetent. The property itself was not bad, but the performance and unprofessional attitude of the staff ruined our stay in Venice. I've stayed at several hotels in this price range in the San Marco area of Venice recently, and this one is by far the worst. I had heard that people had good experiences here in the off season, but the staff clearly can't handle running the place during the peak visitor season of the summer. I will never return here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at La Commedia”
Reviews.Author: J&MWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: I booked our Venice trip as a suprise for my Husband's 30th Birthday. We had an amazing stay in Venice which we thought was a fabulous city. The hotel was everything all the reviews said - clean, modern, great location and good value for money. I'm so glad I booked this hotel and not some of the others I was originally considering! I can't imagine anyone would be disappointed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: candyedinburgh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from the Hotel A La Commedia in Venice. The hotel is situated in a great location, about 1 minute walk from the Grand Canal and the Rialto Bridge, and about a 5 minutes walk from St Marks Square. Although you do not have a veiw of the canal, and the views are not spectacular, this does not disadvantage the hotel. It is situated amongst the designer shopping centre, close to the theatre and the concert halls, and restaurants. The hotel is very modern, exceptionally clean, and because it is quite small has an intimate feel about it. Our room was quite compact, and was in red and gold and felt very opulant. The bathroom is ultra modern, and cleaned twice a day. The chambermaids are very discreet and due to the electronic key system, they know when you are out of your room, so never disturb you. The bathroom was big, with overhead shower, and hand shower, marble decor will all modern fittings. The room had LCD T.V which has about 3 or 4 channels in English. Not that you have time to watch TV when you are in Venice! My only complaint about the hotel was the bed. The kingsize bed was actually two singles joined together, and the mattress was extremely hard as were the pillows, in fact it was like sleeping on concrete. We probably should have asked to change rooms and I am sure that would not have been a problem,as the staff were excellent. My baggage had gone missing and the airline did not deliver my case until my last day. The hotel staff went out of their way to help me, and contacted the airline veryday by phone and email to chase the missing baggage, all at no extra cost. They were helpful with everything you asked for help with, and always pleasant without being over the top. As they had been so helpful we did not pursue changing our rooms, which we probably should have. The breakfast room is delightful in red and gold, again giving the feeling of opulance, and the breakfast is buffet in style, with a range of cereals, fruit, croissants, rolls, ham, cheese etc. The waiting staff were very smartly dressed in uniforms, very attentive and helpful. Overall it is a good hotel, and I would recommend this to anyone visiting Venice for a short break. Have a look at their website before booking, as the pictures of the amenities are a true reflection of what the hotel is like.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: 2random
Reviews.Content: This new hotel is well situated near to the Rialto Bridge and within easy walk of Venice's many attractions. Customer service was excellent; our room had a problem with the electrics and so the management arranged a first class suite at an alternative hotel for one night, and we returned to our room the next day to find a free bottle of wine as a thank you. They even gave us a small gift for my birthday. The hotel does not have its own restaurant, but this is not really needed given its location. The roof terrace is nice to sit out on, and the air conditioned rooms are comfortable and roomy. We enjoyed our stay and recommend the hotel wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “A top rate hotel by any standard”
Reviews.Author: Skiparkie
Reviews.Content: Our stay was exceptionally good. The staff are excellent, polite, friendly and very helpful. The rooms were of a very high standard with all amenities. The situation is wonderful for it is both in walking distance to St Mark's Square and to the Grand Canal, with close and easy access to both Water Taxis and Water Buses.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel a La Commedia
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 4596/A | Corte Del Teatro Goldoni, 30124 Venice, Italy
